DMBP00001575	an.guil.li.sep’ti.ca. L. n. anguilla eel; Gr. adj. septica putrefactive;M.L. adj. anguilliseptica pertaining to diseased eels.The description below is taken from the original paper.Rods, 0.4 × 2.0 μm, with a tendency to become filamentous. Motile by a single polar flagellum; motility is better at 15?C than at 25?C. Catalase and oxidase reactions positive.Gelatin is liquefied. Nitrate reduction, urease, fluorescent pigment production, and starch hydrolysis are all negative.There is no acid production from arabinose, xylose, rhamnose, fructose, galactose, glucose, mannose, sorbose, lactose,maltose, raffinose, sucrose, starch, dextrin, salicin, glycerol,mannitol, or inositol. rDNA sequencing studies place this species close to P. aeruginosa (see Figure 4). Isolated from diseased pond-cultured eels (Anguilla japonica).The mol% G + C of the DNA is: unknown.Type strain: ATCC 33660, DSM 12111, NCMB 1949.GenBank accession number (16S rRNA): X99540.
DMBP00001576	Pseudomonas antarctica (an.tarc′ti.ca. N.L. fem. adj. antarctica pertaining to Antarctica).Forms circular, convex, smooth and translucent colonies with a diameter of 1–2 mm. Cells are Gram-negative, motile with a polar flagellum, rod-shaped and psychrophilic (grow at 4–30 °C), can tolerate 3 % NaCl (w/v) and grow at an optimum pH of 7. Positive for catalase, oxidase, urease and phosphatase and weakly positive for lipase; reduces nitrate to nitrite; negative for β-galactosidase, gelatinase, arginine dihydrolase, arginine decarboxylase, lysine decarboxylase, indole production, methyl red and Voges–Proskauer test. Does not hydrolyse aesculin, starch or cellulose. Acid is produced from d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-mannose and d-mannitol, but not from l-arabinose, lactose, l-rhamnose, sucrose or d-xylose. Utilizes acetate, adonitol, citrate, meso-erythritol, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, meso-inositol, lactic acid, d-mannose, d-mannitol, pyruvate, d-ribose, sorbitol, trehalose, l-alanine, l-arginine, l-glutamic acid, l-glutamine, l-lysine, l-serine, l-tyrosine and l-tryptophan as sole carbon sources, but not l-arabinose, d-cellobiose, cellulose, dextran, dulcitol, fumaric acid, inulin, lactose, d-maltose, d-melibiose, melezitose, d-raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbose, sucrose, succinic acid, thioglycollate, d-xylose, l-aspartic acid, l-aspargine, l-cysteine, l-glycine, l-histidine, l-leucine, l-isoleucine, l-methionine, l-proline, l-threonine or l-valine. Sensitive to the antibiotics ampicillin, amoxycillin, bacitracin, carbenicillin, chloramphenicol, chlortetracycline, colistin, cotrimoxazole, erythromycin, kanamycin, gentamicin, lincomycin, nitrofurazone, nitrofurantoin, nystatin, oxytetracyclin, penicillin, polymyxin B, rifampicin, tetracycline and tobramycin, but resistant to furazolidone, furoxone and trimethoprim. DNA G+C content is 60·7 mol%.The type strain is CMS 35T (=MTCC 4992T=DSM 15318T).
DMBP00001577	DESCRIPTION OF PSEUDOMONAS ARCUSCAELESTIS SP. NOV. Pseudomonas arcuscaelestis sp. nov. (ar.cus.cae.les′tis. L. n. arcus caelestis, a rainbow, N.L. gen. n. arcuscaelestis, of a rainbow, referring to the isolation of this strain from a rainbow trout). Cells are aerobic, Gram-stain-negative, rod-shaped (1.2–3.4 µm long and 0.6–1.0 µm wide), motile with one polar flagellum and catalase- and oxidase-positive. Colonies on LB agar are round or oval, flat, opaque and beige-coloured with irregular margins, and are approximately 3–5 mm in diameter after growth for 2 days at 30 °C. Fluorescein pigment is produced, but pyocyanin is not. Bacterial growth occurs at a temperature range of 4–37 °C and at a pH range from pH 6 to 10. Cells tolerate 0–6% NaCl. In the API 20 NE test, strains are positive for the reduction of nitrate to nitrite and the assimilation of glucose, gluconate, caprate, malate and citrate. According to the plate test analysis using the Biolog GEN III system, it has the ability to oxidize a variety of carbon sources: α-d-glucose, methyl pyruvate, γ-amino-butyric acid, d-fructose, l-alanine, l-arginine, d-gluconic acid, l-lactic acid, β-hydroxy-d,l-butyric acid, glycogen, l-aspartic acid, citric acid, l-glutamic acid, α-keto glutaric acid, l-histidine, d-malic acid, propionic acid, l-pyroglutamic acid, quinic acid, l-malic acid, acetic acid, d-serine, l-serine and formic acid. Strains are able to grow in the presence of 1% sodium lactate, troleandomycin, lincomycin, vancomycin, nalidixic acid, aztreonam, fusidic acid, rifamycin SV, guanidine HCL, tetrazolium violet, lithium chloride, sodium butyrate, d-serine, minocycline, nioproof 4, tetrazolium blue, potassium tellurite and sodium bromate. Strains produce variable results for indole production and the presence of arginine dihydrolase in the API test, and for the α-hydroxybutyric acid and mucic acid tests in Biolog plates. Results for other characteristic tests are negative or weak. The predominant cellular fatty acids of strains P66T, V1 and W15Feb18 include summed feature 3 (36.44–37.55%), C16:0 (29.91–31.68%), summed feature 8 (13.53–16.25%), C12:0-2OH (3.96–4.67%), C12:0-3OH (4.02–4.31%), C10:0-3OH (3.53–3.90%) and C12:0 (2.66–3.21%). The type strain is P66T (=CECT 30176T=CCUG 74872T) isolated from Oncorhynchus mykiss. The DNA G+C base composition is 58.52 mol%. Strain P66T was isolated from rainbow trout (Oncorhynchus mykiss) cultivated at a fish farm in Turkey.
DMBP00001578	Pseudomonas argentinensis (ar.gen′tin.en.sis. N.L. fem. adj. argentinensis pertaining to the Argentine, of the Argentine).Gram-negative, strictly aerobic, non-spore-forming, rod-shaped cells of 1·3–1·9?μm in length and 0·5–0·7?μm in diameter; motile with a single polar flagellum. Colonies on nutrient agar are circular, convex, yellow, translucent and usually 0·5–2·5?mm in diameter, within 2?days of growth at 25?°C. Does not grow at 4 or 41?°C. The metabolism is oxidative, and no sugars are fermented in peptone media. A water-insoluble yellow pigment is produced on nutrient agar, with a major absorbance peak at 442?nm, and a fluorescent pigment is also produced at a low rate on King's B medium. Oxidase- and catalase-positive, and does not hydrolyse casein, aesculin or gelatin. The arginine dihydrolase system is not present. Urease, tryptophan deaminase and β-galactosidase are not produced. Nitrate is reduced to nitrite. Assimilates l-arabinose, galactose, glucose, d-fructose, mannose, mannitol, trehalose, d-fucose, β-gentiobiose, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate, caprate, malate and citrate. Utilization of glycerol, d-ribose, d-xylose, melibiose and d-arabitol as sole carbon source is strain-dependent. Does not assimilate adipate, phenylacetate, d-arabinose, l-fucose, inositol, adonitol, l-arabitol, l-lyxose, xylitol, l-xylose, l-sorbose, methyl β-d-xyloside, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, l-rhamnose, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, lactose, sucrose, inulin, melezitose, d-raffinose, starch, glycogen, erythritol, sorbitol, dulcitol, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, d-turanose, d-tagatose or 5-ketogluconate. The fatty acid pattern is shown in Table?2T2.The type strain is CH01T (=LMG 22563T=CECT 7010T), which has a G+C content of 57·5?mol%.  Published online ahead of print on 23 December 2004 as DOI 10.1099/ijs.0.63445-0.The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers for the 16S rRNA gene sequences of strains CH01T and PA01 are AY691188 and AY691189, respectively.A phylogenetic tree for Pseudomonas argentinensis sp. nov. and related species of the genus Pseudomonas sensu stricto, rep-PCR patterns, similarity matrix data and reciprocal values for percentage DNA–DNA hybridization are available as supplementary material in IJSEM Online.During a study in the Argentinian region of Chaco (Córdoba), some strains were isolated from the rhizosphere of grasses growing in semi-desertic arid soils
DMBP00001579	Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, oxidase and catalase positive, rod shaped, of about 5.5 u.m in length and 0.5-1.0 p.m in diameter.Motile by means of multiple polar flagella. Optimal temperature for growth is 30°C; but growth occurs between 4 and 37oC, but not at 41 °C. Optimal pH for growth ranges between 7.5 and 8.0.Growth occurs at pH 6.5 and 10.0, but not at pH 6.0 or 10.5.Growth occurs in the presence of 0-2% (w/v) NaCl; but optimal growth occurs without adding NaCI to the media. HzS and indole are not produced. Fluorescent pigments are not produced on King B medium. Hydrolysis of arginine, triglyceride and urea are positive. Enzymatic hydrolysis of p-nitrophenyl-n-acetylβ-D-glucosaminide, and proline-β-naphthylamide are positive;and hydrolysis of aliphatic thiol, p-nitrophenyl-phosphoester, p-nitrophenyl-alpha-D-glucoside, p-nitrophenyl-β-D-glucoside, p-nitrophenyl-B-D-galactoside, pyrrolidine-B-naphthylamide, gamma-glutamyl-B-naphthylamide,tryptophan-βnaphthylamide, N-benzyl-arginine-B-naphthylamide are negative.Lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and tryptophar deaminase are negative. Utilization of tryptophan, nitrate, and glucose is negative. In assays with the API 20NE, L-arginine, D-glucose, L-arabinose, D-mannose, D-mannitol, N-acetyl-glucosamine, potassium gluconatecapric acid are positive, but L-tryptophan, urea, aesculin, ferric citrate, p-nitrophenyl-?-D-galactopyranoside,D-malse are negative.VC-1 could be differentiated from its closest relatives by its multiple polar flagella, its ability to grow with acetate, arabinose and sorbitol as sole carbon sources, the enzymatic activity of arginine dihydrolase (ADH), and the absence of fluorescent pigments on King B media. In addition, none of the closest relative reference strains used could oxidize arsenite, a character that additionally differentiated VC-1. Other phenotypic characteristics are given in Table 1 and supplementary Table S1. This strain is able to tolerate 5 mM As[III] and to oxidize 100% of the arsenite present in the medium with lactate as a carbon source. The type strain is VC-1 (CCUG 58201T; CECT 7543T). 
DMBP00001580	 Pseudomonas asiatica (a.si.a′ti.ca. L. fem. adj. asiatica from or originating from Asia, where the type strain was isolated).The cells of this species are aerobic, Gram-negative, non-spore-forming, motile and rod-shaped, being 0.5–1.0 µm wide and 2.0–2.5 µm long, Colonies on TSA are circular, convex, creamy and usually 0.5–2.5 mm in diameter after growth for 2 days at 30 °C. These bacteria grow at temperatures between 4–40 °C and in the presence of 0–5.5 % (w/v) NaCl. They produce catalase and cytochrome oxidase, as well as fluorescent pigments on King’s B agar at 30 °C. Based on Biolog GEN III Microplate assays, these bacteria can utilize α-d-glucose, d-mannose, d-fructose, d-fucose, inosine, glycerol, d-serine, l-alanine, l-arginine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-serine, d-gluconic acid, glucuronamide, mucic acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, l-lactic acid, citric acid, α-keto-glutaric acid, l-malic acid, γ-amino-butyric acid, β-hydroxy-d,l-butyric acid, propionic acid, acetic acid and formic acid and can grow in the presence of 8 % NaCl, 1 % sodium lactate, fusidic acid, troleandomycin, rifamycin SV, minocycline, lincomycin, guanidine HCl, niaproof 4, vancomycin, tetrazolium violet, tetrazolium blue, nalidixic acid, lithium chloride, potassium tellurite, aztreonam, sodium butyrate and sodium bromate. In API 20NE tests, the bacteria are positive for l-tryptophan, l-arginine, glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, potassium gluconate, n-capric acid, adipic acid, dl-malic acid, sodium citrate and phenylmercuric acetate. In API ZYM tests, results are positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine allylamidase, acid phosphatase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase activities. The major fatty acids in RYU5T are C12 : 0 2-OH, C12 : 0 3-OH, C16 : 0, summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c/C16 : 1ω6c) and summed feature 8 (C18 : 1ω7c/C18 : 1ω6c).The type strain, RYU5T (=DSM 107182T, =JCM 32716T), was isolated from a stool sample of a patient hospitalized at the University of the Ryukyus Hospital, Okinawa, Japan. Whole genome sequencing showed that the DNA G+C content of the type strain was 62.25 mol%.

DMBP00001582	Pseudomonas asturiensis sp. nov. (as.tu.ri.en'sis N.L. fem. adj.asturiensis, from Asturias, where the strains were isolated) Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, rods (1.0 μ.m wide and 1.5-4.0 μm long) and motile. Colonies are beige, round, entire, slightly raised, measure 2-3 mm in diameter after 1 day in incubation on TSA at 28°C. Most strains produce fluorescent pigments on King's B medium and are negative for pectinolytic activity.Growth generally occurs on TSA and on King B at 4-36°C and up to 6% NaCl. Cells are oxidative in Hugh-Leifson medium, positive for the tobacco hypersensitivity, catalase, esculin, gelatin, betaine, trigonelline, quinate, erythritol, L-lactate, L-arabinose, Dribose, D-xylose, D-galactose, D-glucose, D-fructose, D-mannose, M-inositol, D-mannitol, D-fucose and D-arabitol tests, negative for the levan, oxidase, arginine dihydrolase, sorbitol, sucrose, adonitol, homoserine, D-tartrate tests and variable for casein and D-melibiose tests. They have alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-ASBI-phosphohydrolase and ?-glucosidase activities. The DNA G+C content ranges between 58.6 and 59.0 mol%. The major cellular fatty acids are C10:0 3-OH, C12:0, C12:0 2-OH, C12:0 3-0H, C16:0, C18:1ω70 and C16:17c/iso C15:0 2-OH. C17:0 cyclo is present in low amounts(around 2%).The type strain, LPPA 221T (=LMG 26898T =CECT 8095T), was isolated from leaves of soy bean crop collected from Villaviciosa, Asturias, Spain.
DMBP00001583	Pseudomonas atacamensis (a.ta.cam.en’sis. N.L. masc. adj. atacamensis belonging to the Atacama Desert of northern Chile, from which the type strain was isolated). Cells are gram-stain-negative, rod-shaped, nonsporulated, 0.9–1.2 µm wide, 1.9–2.8 µm long and motile by a single polar flagellum. After incubation at 25 C for 3 days, colonies on LB agar are 1-2 mm in diameter, creamy, smooth, circular, convex and nonswarming. Growth occurs at the temperature range 4-37 C (optimum, 28 C), with 0-4% NaCl concentrations. Strain M7D1T is strictly aerobic, positive for oxidase and catalase. It was negative for H2S production. According to API ZYM tests, it is positive for esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, and naphthol-AS-BIphosphohydrolase activity, and it is negative for alkaline phosphatase, lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, aglucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase. According to API 20NE tests, the strain M7D1T is positive for L-arginine, D-glucose, L-arabinose, D-mannose, D-mannitol, N-acetyl-glucosamine, potassium gluconate, capril acid, malic acid, trisodium citrate, and oxidase tests, whereas it is negative for nitrate reduction; indole production, glucose fermentation, urease, hydrolysis of aesculin and gelatine, β-galactosidase, D-maltose, and phenylacetic acid. In addition, the strain is positive for threalose and D-galactose assimilation and oxidation. The type strain is M7D1T (= CCUG 73898T- = LMG 31516T ) and was isolated from the rhizosphere of a plant on the Atacama Desert during a bloom event. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 59.9%.  
DMBP00001584	This strain, which has been named for Atago Mountain, the source of the original sample, was found to be Gram-negative, motile, rod-shaped, oxidase-positive, and catalase-positive. Cells were observed to be 1.0–1.7 μm long and 0.4–0.6 μm wide. Colonies grown on TSA agar for 24 h at 28 °C were moist and creamy-white in color due to extracellular substances. Concentrated cell pellet was beige-colored. Growth was observed at temperatures of 5–32 °C, with optimum growth at 24–28 °C. The strain could grow in the presence of 0–4% (w/v) NaCl and at pH between 5 and 8 and produced a fluorescent pigment when grown on King B agar. Major fatty acids were C16:0, C17:0 cyclo, summed feature 3 (C16:1 ω6c and/or C16:1 ω7c), and summed feature 8 (C18:1 ω7c and/or 18:1 ω6c). On API 20 NE tests, this strain was positive for L-arginine, gelatin, d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetyl-glucosamine, potassium gluconate, capric acid, malic acid, and trisodium citrate. Biolog GEN III Microplate assays showed that these bacteria can utilize α- d-glucose, d-mannose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-fucose, inosine, d-mannitol, glycerol, l-alanine, l-arginine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-serine, d-gluconic acid, glucuronamide, mucic acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, l-lactic acid, citric acid, α-keto-glutaric acid, l-malic acid, γ-amino-butryric acid, β-hydroxy-D L-butyric acid, propionic acid, and acetic acid and was able to grow in the presence of 1% sodium lactate, fusidic acid, d-serine, troleandomycin, rifamycin SV, lincomycin, guanidine HCl, niaproof 4, vancomycin, tetrazolium violet, tetrazolium blue, nalidixic acid, lithium chloride, potassium tellurite, and aztreonam. The G+C content of the type strain is 59.58%. The type strain, PS14T (=?CECT 9940T,?=?LMG 31496T), was isolated from soil collected at Mt. Atago, which is located in the northwest part of Izu Oshima, Tokyo, Japan.

DMBP00001587	Pseudomonas azotifigens [a.zo.ti.fi′gens. French n. azote (from Gr. pref. a- and Gr. n. zoê) nitrogen; N.L. n. azotum -i nitrogen; L. part. figens (from L. v. figo) fixing; N.L. part. adj. azotifigens nitrogen fixing].Cells are Gram-negative straight rods, 2–5 μm long and 0·5 μm wide, and motile. Colonies are translucent, wrinkled and with obscure edges when grown on LB agar. Growth in LB medium is observed at pH 6·1–9·8, 28–41 °C and in the presence of 2·5–5 % NaCl. Nitrogen fixation in NFMM is observed in the presence of 2–6 % oxygen in the gas phase. Catalase and oxidase are produced. No pigments are produced on King medium A or Luisetti medium. Nitrate reduction and denitrification are negative. Starch and Tween 80 are hydrolysed. The following substrates are oxidized: acetic acid, cis-aconitic acid, l-alaninamide, d-alanine, l-alanine, d-arabitol, l-asparagine, bromosuccinic acid, citric acid, formic acid, d-gluconic acid, α-d-glucose, l-glutamic acid, glycogen, hydroxy-l-proline, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, itaconic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, dl-lactic acid, l-leucine, d-mannitol, methyl pyruvate, monomethyl succinate, l-proline, propionic acid, d-psicose, l-pyroglutamic acid, d-saccharic acid, sebacic acid, succinamic acid, succinic acid and Tweens 40 and 80. The following substrates are oxidized weakly: l-alanylglycine, l-aspartic acid, d-cellobiose, d-fructose, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, d-serine, l-serine and l-threonine. The G+C content of the type strain is 66·3 mol%.The type strain, 6H33bT (=ATCC BAA-1049T=JCM 12708T), was isolated from a compost pile in Japan.
DMBP00001588	Pseudomonas azotoformans nov. sp.Strain: F-3.本菌種は米より非常に低い率で分離され,約300株のPseudomonas のなかより1株を得たにすぎない,著者ら(3)は石油及び天然ガスの微生物学的研究において,本菌種を石油油層水からも多数分離した,その特徴とするところは硝酸呼吸能を有し,地下の油層水に多数認められることである.本菌種が硝酸呼吸能を有することは,ほとんど無酸素と考えられる地下に存在することを説明するものである。このような特徴に基づき新種として発表したものである.なお供試菌株は日本産級より分離した。記載Rods, 0.6 to 0.8 by 1.4 to 2.0 microns. Glutamate agar slant: Moderate growth, filiform, translucent, greenish gray, medium yellowish green. Potato agar slant : Moderate growth, filiform, greenish white, medium slightly greenish yellow. DMBP00001589	Pseudomonas baetica (ba.e′ti.ca. L. fem. adj. baetica of or belonging to Hispania Baetica, the name of the former province of the Roman Empire covering the south-west region of Spain).Pseudomonas baetica (ba.e′ti.ca. L. fem. adj. baetica of or belonging to Hispania Baetica, the name of the former province of the Roman Empire covering the south-west region of Spain).Cells are Gram-negative, motile, large irregular rods. Colonies on TSA are small (up to approx. 0.5 mm in diameter after 48 h of incubation), round and whitish. Metabolism is oxidative. Cytochrome oxidase and catalase are produced. Growth occurs at 4–30 °C in the presence of 0–6 % NaCl. Fluorescein pigment is produced, but pyocyanin is not. Arginine dihydrolase is produced, but lysine and ornithine are not decarboxylated. Nitrate to nitrite reduction test is negative, but denitrification to N2 gas is positive. Does not grow on TCBS agar. Voges–Proskauer, indole and H2S production and ONPG (β-galactosidase) tests are negative. Simmons’ citrate test is positive. Haemolytic on blood agar. Known strains hydrolyse gelatin and casein, but not starch, Tween 80, aesculin or urea. Acid is produced from glucose and mannose, but not from mannitol, inositol, sorbitol, rhamnose, sucrose, amygdalin, arabinose, lactose or salicin. Acid production from melibiose is variable (type strain negative). Gas is not produced from glucose. The following substrates are utilized as sole carbon sources for growth (Biolog GN2): Tweens 40 and 80, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, d-fructose, d-galactose, α-d-glucose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, methyl pyruvate, acetic acid, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-gluconic acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, dl-lactic acid, malonic acid, propionic acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, d- and l-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-leucine, l-proline, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-serine, γ-aminobutyric acid, urocanic acid, inosine, uridine and glycerol. The following substrates are not used: α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, glycogen, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, adonitol, cellobiose, i-erythritol, l-fucose, gentiobiose, myo-inositol, lactose, lactulose, maltose, melibiose, methyl β-d-glucoside, d-psicose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, turanose, xylitol, formic acid, d-galacturonic acid, d-glucosaminic acid, d-glucuronic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, itaconic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, sebacic acid, succinamic acid, glucuronamide, l-alaninamide, glycyl l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, hydroxy-l-proline, l-ornithine, l-phenylalanine, d-serine, dl-carnitine, thymidine, phenylethylamine, 2,3-butanediol, dl-α-glycerol phosphate, glucose 1-phosphate and glucose 6-phosphate. Variable results for utilization of l-histidine, l-threonine, putrescine, 2-aminoethanol and monomethyl succinate (type strain negative). The following enzymes are produced (API ZYM): esterase lipase (C8) and acid phosphatase; most strains, including the type strain, produce alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4) and leucine arylamidase but not α-fucosidase, lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase or α-mannosidase. The cellular fatty acid composition is dominated by saturated and unsaturated C16 and C18 fatty acids (type strain profile available in Table S1). Sensitive to (µg per disc) novobiocin (30) and resistant to the vibriostatic agent O/129 (10 and 150) and ampicillin (10).The type strain is a390T ( = CECT 7720T  = LMG 25716T), isolated in 2006 from the liver of a diseased wedge sole on the south-west coast of Spain and pathogenic for this flatfish species. A reference strain is a391 ( = CECT 7721  = LMG 25717), isolated during the same outbreak.
DMBP00001590	Pseudomonas balearica (ba.le.a’ri.ca.L. fem. adj. balearica. of the Balearic Islands, where the organism was isolated). Gram-negative, short, straight, rod-shaped cells that are 0.3 to 0.5 μm wide and 1.5 to 3.0 μm long. Motile by means of a single polar flagellum. Strictly oxidative. Vigorous denitrifier that liberates copious amounts of nitrogen gas from nitrate. Nonpigmented. Has some of the same phenotypic and morphological characteristics as P. stutzeri, including the following: amylase and maltose positive, arginine dihydrolase and gelatinase negative, and a characteristic wrinkly dry colony morphology when isolates are fresh. Can be differentiated from P. stutzeri by its ability to grow at 46°C and its ability to grow in the presence of 8.5% NaCl, as well as its ability to use xylose as a sole carbon and energy source and its inability to use mannitol, ethylene glycol, 4-aminobutyrate, and suberate. The two strains that have been isolated were isolated as 2-methylnaphthalene degraders at 40°C from wastewater or marine sediment samples.The G+C content ranges from 64.1 to 64.4 mol%, as determined by high-performance liquid chromatography (18). The type strain is strain SP1402 (= DSM 6083).
DMBP00001591	DESCRIPTION OF PSEUDOMONAS BALTICA SP. NOV Pseudomonas baltica (bal.ti.ca. M.L. fem. adj. baltica of or belonging to the Baltic Sea, where the strain was identified). The colonies of this species are yellow, convex and circular with a diameter of 1mm after incubation at 30 °C for 24h on TSA. The rod-shaped cells (see Fig. 7) have a length of 2.1 μm–3.5 μm (mean 2.5µm) and a width of 0.9 μm–1.3 μm (mean 1.1µm) and are Gram-stain-negative, catalase-positive, oxidase-negative, weakly motile and non-endospore-forming. MBT-2T shows no β-haemolysis when cultivated on Columbia agar supplemented with 5% sheep blood. Grows on R2A agar, only weakly under anaerobic conditions but not on cetrimide agar. Pigments are produced on King A agar, but no pigments are visible on King B agar. Growth is detected from 4 to 30 °C (growth at temperatures lower than 4 °C have not been tested), with an optimal growth temperature between 20 and 25 °C. pH values between pH 6.0 and 8.0 are tolerated (optimal pH 6.5–7.5) as well as salt concentrations of up to 5.0% (w/v; optimum, 0.5–1.0%). Strain MBT-2T shows no starch hydrolysis, no proteolysis on skimmed milk agar but lipolysis on tributyrin agar at both 20 and 30 °C. Positive reactions are observed for arginine dihydrolase, citrate utilization and for denitrification, but negative ones for β-galactosidase, H2 S production, urease, tryptophan deaminase, indole production and gelatin hydrolysis. Lysine decarboxylase (2/3), ornithine decarboxylase (1/3) and Voges–Proskauer reaction (2/3) are variable. Positive for the utilization of glycerin, l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, melibiose, d-gentiobiose and d-fucose. Acid production of l-rhamnose, l-xylose and d-arabitol is weakly positive. MBT-2T does not produce acid from d-adonitol, aesculin, starch, l-arabitol, d-arabinose, arbutin, amygdalin, cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, l-fucose, glycogen, methyl α-d-glucoside, inulin, inositol, maltose, methyl α-d- mannoside, melezitose, N-acetylglucosamine, potassium-gluconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate raffinose, salicin, l-sorbose, sucrose, trehalose, d-tagatose, turanose, xylitol, methyl β-d-xylopyranose and l-xylose. The predominant fatty acids of the type strain are summed feature 3 (C16:17c/C16:16c; 39.61%), C16:0 (25.47%), summed feature 8 (C18:17c; 19.66%), C12:0 (4.25%), C12:0 3-OH (4.12%), C12:0 2-OH (2.93%) and C10:0 3-OH (2.69%). The type strain is MBT-2T (DSM 111761T/ LMG 31955T , DDBJ/EMBL/ GenBank accession number JACMYH000000000) which was isolated from raw milk. It has a DNA G+C content of 62.48mol% and a genome size of 4.58Mb with 28 contigs.
DMBP00001592	ben.ze.ni.vo’rans N.L. neut. n. benzenum, benzene; L. part. adj. vorans, devouring, digesting; N.L. fem. part. adj. benzenivorans, digesting benzene.Gram-negative motile rods, 2.3–2.9 × 0.6 μm in size. Colonies on TSA are convex with slightly uneven rims, smooth, opaque and cream coloured; oxidase positive, non-fluorescent, non-denitrifying. Able to hydrolyse starch and to utilize maltose, l-histidine, l-ornithine, 4-aminobutyric acid, d-galacturonic acid, saccharic acid and quinic acid. Does not utilize sebacic acid and capric acid. Grows up to 39°C. More physiological properties given in Table 2. Positive reactions of strain DSM 8628T in BIOLOG GN plates for dextrin, glycogen, Tween 40, Tween 80, d-fructose, α-d-glucose, maltose, methylpyruvate, monomethylsuccinate, acetic acid, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, d-galacturonic acid, d-gluconic acid, d-glucuronic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, itaconic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, d,l-lactic acid, malonic acid, propionic acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, alaninamide, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-alanyl-glycine, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-leucine, l-ornithine, l-phenylalanine, l-proline, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-serine, l-threonine, d,l-carnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid, urocanic acid and putrescine. Main fatty acid components are C16:1ω7c, C18:1ω7c, C16:0. Hydroxylated acids are C10:03-OH (5.59%) C12:02-OH (0.21%), C12:13-OH (5.14%) and C12:03-OH (4.41%).The type strain is DSM 8628T (=CIP 109857T) isolated from contaminated groundwater from an industrial plant site located at the Gulf Coast of the USA. It is able to grow on benzene, toluene or para-cresol as the sole source of carbon and energy. GenBank accession number for its 16S rRNA gene sequence is FM208263.

DMBP00001594	DESCRIPTION OF PSEUDOMONAS BIJIEENSIS SP. NOV. Pseudomonas bijieensis (bi.jie. en’sis. N.L. fem. adj. bijieensis pertaining to Bijie, a city in Guizhou Province, PR China, where the type strain was isolated). Cells of strain L22-9T are Gram-stain-negative, rod-shaped, 1.0–2.0µm long and 0.5–0.7µm wide, motile with a polar flagellum, oxidase-positive and catalase-positive. Colonies on LB agar are smooth, cream-coloured and after 2weeks the cells produce dark brown pigment that colours the agar and the colonies. Positive for blue fluorescence on King B medium under 365nm UV light. Negative for pyocyanin production on King A medium. Growth occurs at 2–39 °C (optimum, 28 °C), pH 5–8 (optimum, pH 6.5–7.5) and in 0–6% (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 1–3%). In API 20 NE tests, the strain is positive for arginine dihydrolase (weakly), gelatin hydrolysis, assimilation of d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetyl-glucosamine, potassium gluconate, capric acid, malic acid and trisodium citrate. Results obtained with API50 CH strips indicate that the strain oxidizes the following substrates: l-arabinose, d-xylose, galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, sucrose, trehalose and melibiose. In API ZYM tests, the strain is positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin and naphthol-AS-Bi-phosphohydrolase. Biolog GEN Ⅲ MicroPlate assays show that this strain can utilize α-d-glucose, d-mannose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-fucose, l-fucose, fusidic acid, d-fructose-6-PO4, d-serine, l-serine, l-galactonic acid lactone, glucuronamide, mucic acid, quinic acid, propionic acid, acetic acid, p-hydroxy-phenylacetic acid and citric acid. The strain can grow in the presence of pH 6, 1% NaCl, 1% sodium lactate, troleandomycin, rifamycin SV, lincomycin, guanidine HCl, niaproof 4, vancomycin, tetrazolium violet, tetrazolium blue, nalidixic acid, lithium chloride, potassium tellurite and aztreonam. The major fatty acids (>5%) are C16:0 , summed feature 3 (C16:16c and/or C16:17c), summed feature 8 (C18:17c and/or C18:16c) and C17:0 cyclo. The type strain, L22-9T (=CGMCC1.18528T=LMG 31948T), was isolated from cornfield soil collected in Bijie, Guizhou Province, PR China. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 60.85mol%.The complete genome sequence of strain L22-9T has been deposited in GenBank under the accession number CP048810. The GenBank accession number for its complete 16S rRNA gene sequence is MT835388.
DMBP00001595	Pseudomonas bohemica (bo.he'mi.ca. M.L.adj. related to Bohemia, the region in the Czech Republic were the type strain was isolated). Temperature for growth ranges between 4 and 37, growth pH ranges between 6.5 and 8. Optimal growth occurs at 25°C and pH 7–8. Able to grow with up to 2.5% NaCl in TSB. The respiratory ubiquinones are Q9 (97%) and Q8 (3%). C16:0 (30.5%) and in summed feature 3 (20.1%) are the main fatty acids. Oxidase- and catalase-positive. In the API20NE system, aesculin hydrolysis, assimilation of D-glucose, L-arabinose, D-mannose, D-mannitol, potassium gluconate and trisodium citrate are positive whereas reduction of nitrates, glucose fermentation, production of gelatinase, urease, indole arginine dihydrolase and ?-galactosidase and assimilation of adonitol, methyl-xyloside, N-acetyl glucosamine, D-maltose, caprate, adipate, malate and phenylacetate are negative. In API 50CH, it produces acid from D-glucose, glycerol, ribose, L-xylose, L-fructose, D-mannose, L-arabinose, amigdalin, arbutine and salicin.The type strain, IA19T (=CECT 9403T = LMG 30182T), was isolated from a bark beetle from the species Ips acuminatus in the Czech Republic. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 59.5 mol%.
DMBP00001596	Pseudomonas borbori (bor′bo.ri. Gr. n. borboros sludge; N.L. gen. n. borbori of sludge).After 24 h incubation at 28 °C on TSA, colonies are 1–2 mm, smooth, round with irregular edges and beige. Cells are rod-shaped (1 μm wide and 2–3 μm long) with rounded ends, Gram-negative, non-spore-forming and non-fluorescent. Cells are motile and oxidase- and catalase-positive. After 24 h, good growth is observed at 22–28 °C, but not at 4 °C or above 37 °C. No anaerobic growth is observed. Enzyme activities and carbon source utilization are given in Table 3T3. Can be differentiated from all P. straminea strains characterized by Uchino et al. (2000) by the ability to assimilate d-maltose and the inability to assimilate l-arabinose, d-galactose, d-mannose and d-mannitol. Can be differentiated from all P. flavescens strains characterized by Uchino et al. (2000) and Hildebrand et al. (1994) by the ability to assimilate d-maltose and the inability to assimilate d-galactose, d-mannose, d-mannitol and d-trehalose. Can be differentiated from all P. argentinensis strains characterized by Peix et al. (2005) by the ability to assimilate d-maltose and the inability to assimilate l-arabinose, d-galactose, d-mannose, d-mannitol and d-trehalose. Can be differentiated from P. anguilliseptica LMG 21629T by the ability to assimilate d-glucose, d-maltose and gluconate, the inability to assimilate d-galactose and the absence of acid phosphatase. Can be differentiated from P. peli by the ability to reduce nitrate and to assimilate d-glucose, d-maltose and gluconate.The type strain is LMG 23199T (=DSM 17834T=R-20821T), which has a DNA G+C content of 60.7 mol%. The type strain and eight other strains were isolated from a nitrifying inoculum in Gent, Belgium (Table 1T1). 
DMBP00001597	nan
DMBP00001600	 Pseudomonas brassicae (bras'si.cae. L. gen. n. brassicae of Brassica oleracea var. italica (broccoli), referring to its isolation from the lesion of diseased broccoli).Cells are Gram-reaction-negative, aerobic, approximately 0.9–1.3×1.6–3.0 µm in size, motile with one or two polar flagella, non-spore-forming and rod-shaped. Colonies on standard method agar plates are pale yellow, opaque, round with entire to somewhat undulate margins, raised, smooth, glistening and usually 1–2 mm in diameter after growth for 2 days at 27 °C. No water-soluble pigments are produced. Growth occurs at 4–35 °C but not at 37 °C. The strains show positive results for fluorescent pigment production on King’s B medium, oxidase, potato soft rot, arginine dihydrolase and gelatin hydrolysis, and negative results for levan formation from sucrose, tobacco hypersensitive reaction, 2-ketogluconate production, margarine hydrolysis, acid production from sucrose, nitrate reduction, indole production, glucose fermentation, urease, aesculin hydrolysis and β-galactosidase. Plate test analysis performed using the Biolog GEN III MicroPlate system (4 days incubation at 27 °C) indicates that these strains utilize α-d-glucose, d-fructose, inosine, glycerol, l-alanine, l-arginine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-serine, d-galacturonic acid, l-galactonic acid lactone, d-gluconic acid, quinic acid, p‐hydroxyphenylacetic acid, methyl pyruvate, l-lactic acid, citric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, d-malic acid, l-malic acid, bromosuccinic acid, γ-aminobutyric acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, dl-β-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketobutyric acid, propionic acid, acetic acid and formic acid, but fail to utilize dextrin, maltose, trehalose, cellobiose, gentiobiose, sucrose, turanose, stachyose, d-raffinose, α-d-lactose, melibiose, methyl β-d-glucoside, d-salicin, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, N-acetyl-β-d-mannosamine, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl neuraminic acid, d-mannose, d-galactose, 3-methyl glucose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol, d-mannitol, d-arabitol, myo-inositol, d-glucose-6-phosphate, d-aspartic acid, d-serine, gelatin, glycyl-l-proline, l-pyroglutamic acid, mucic acid, d-saccharic acid, d-lactic acid methyl ester and Tween 40. The major fatty acids (>5 % of the total fatty acids) are summed feature 3 (C16 : 1 ω7c/C16 : 1 ω6c), C16 : 0, summed feature 8 (C18 : 1 ω7c/C18 : 1 ω6c) and C17 : 0 cyclo.The type strain, MAFF 212427T (=ICMP 23635T), was isolated from a head rot lesion of broccoli (Brassica oleracea L. var. italica Plenck) in Hokkaido, Japan in 1996, and is pathogenic to broccoli heads. The genomic DNA G+C content of the type strain is 63.4 mol%.
DMBP00001601	4.1. Description of Pseudomonas brenneri sp. nov. Bren’ner. i. M.L. masc. gen. n. brenneri of Brenner, in honor of D.J. Brenner, an American microbiologist, for his contributions to the taxonomy of the families Enterobacteriaceae and Legionellaceae. 4.1.1. Cell and colony characteristics Cells are Gram-negative, asporogeneous, rod-shaped and motile by means of a single polar flagellum. Colonies are smooth on nutrient agar, circular, nonpigmented and hemolytic when grown on blood agar. 4.1.2. Biochemical and physiological characteristics All strains of P. brenneri produce a fluorescent pigment on both the King B and on S1 medium. They grow at 4◦C but not at 41◦C. Arginine dihydrolase, catalase, oxidase, tween esterase, lecithinase, and tributyrin esterase are also produced. Lysine and ornithine are not decarboxylated. Cells can reduce nitrate to nitrite, grow at low salt concentrations (0.8% and 3%) but not at the following upper salinities tested 5% and 7%. Strains do not possess any DNase, coagulase, urease and elastase activities. Fibrinolysis and acetyl-methylcarbinol (acetoin) tests were negative. They are able to form levan from sucrose. Acid is formed from starch. Cells can grow with presence of 2, 3, 5-triphenyltetrazolium chloride (TTZ). Poly-β-hydroxybutyrate is not accumulated. 4.1.3. Assimilation of carbon compounds Ninety percent or more of the strains utilize the following substrates as sole carbon and energy sources: α-D(+) glucose, β-D(+) fructose, D(+) trehalose, D(+) mannose, D(−) ribose, α-L-rhamnose, D(+) arabitol, L(−) arabitol, xylitol, glycerol, myo-inositol, D-mannitol, adonitol, i-erythritol, mucate, L(−) malate, cis-aconitate, citrate, 2-keto-D-gluconate, Nacetyl-D-glucosamine, D-gluconate, protocatechuate, (−) quinate, benzoate, putrescine, α-aminobutyrate, DL-lactate, caprate, caprylate, succinate, fumarate, glutarate, DL-glycerate, itaconate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, L-aspartate, L-glutamate, L-proline, D-alanine, Lalanine, L-serine, malonate, propionate, L-tyrosine. The following compounds are not utilized by 90% or more of the strains: L(+) sorbose, α-D(+) melibiose, sucrose, D(+) raffinose, maltotriose, maltose, α-lactose, lactulose, 1-O-methyl-β-galactopyranoside, 1-O-methyl-α-galactopyranoside, D(+) cellobiose, β-gentiobiose, 1-O-methyl-β-D-glucopyranoside, aesculin, L(+) arabinose, D(+) xylose, palatinose, α-L-fucose, D(+) melezitose, dulcitol, D-tagatose, maltitol, D(+) turanose, D-sorbitol, hydroxyquinoline-β-glucuronide, D-lyxose, 1-O-methyl-α- D-glucopyranoside, 3-O-methyl-D-glucopyranose, D-saccharate, L(+) tartrate, D(−) tartrate, mesotartrate, trans-aconitate, tricarballylate, D-glucuronate, D-galacturonate, 5-keto-D-gluconate, L-tryptophan, phenylacetate, m-hydroxybenzoate, 3-phenylpropionate, m-coumarate, trigonelline, histamine, Lhistidine. 4.1.4. Enzymatic tests Ninety percent or more of the strains possess the following enzyme activities: esterase (C4), esteraselipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, phosphatase acide. None of the strains possess the following enzyme activities: cystine arylamidase, trypsine, α- chymotrypsine, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acethyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase, α-fucosidase. All strains have been isolated from natural mineral waters. No clinical significance is known. The type strain is CFML 97-391T and has been deposited in the Collection de l’Institut Pasteur as CIP 106646T. The G+C content of the type strain is 58 mol%.
DMBP00001602	P. bubulae sp. nov. (bu′bu.lae. L. gen. f. bubulae of beef).Cells are Gram-negative, motile, strictly aerobic, non-spore-forming straight rods (1.9??m long and 0.7??m wide), occurring singly or in pairs, non-fluorescent on King B agar, and positive for catalase and oxidase. Circular, convex, ivory-coloured, smooth, round and glossy colonies, 0.5–1.0?mm in diameter, are formed after incubation at 25?°C for 24?h on Standard-I agar or Caso agar with glucose. Growth occurs at 2–33?°C with an optimum around 25 and 29?°C. Growth occurs at pH 5.5–8.5 and in the presence of up to 6?% (w/v) NaCl. API 20NE results are positive for activity of arginine dihydrolase and for utilization of d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, potassium gluconate, capric acid, malic acid and tri-sodium citrate, and are negative for the production of indole from tryptophan, acid from glucose, urease, hydrolysis of aesculin, β-galactosidase, utilization of N-acetyl glucosamine, gelatin hydrolysis, maltose, adipic acid and phenyl acetate. The type strain utilizes l-arabinose and does not reduce nitrate. API 50 CH tests are positive for utilization of glycerol, d-glucose, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-fructose, d-ribose, d-xylose, d-galactose, d-mannose, l-fucose and d-fucose, but negative for erythritol, l-xylose, d-adonitol, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, l-sorbose, dulcitol, inositol, xylitol, d-lyxose, d-arabitol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin ferric citrate, salicin, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, starch, glycogen, gentiobiose, turanose, d-tagatose, l-arabitol, potassium gluconate, potassium 2-ketogluconate and potassium 5-ketogluconate. Strains vary in the utilization of d-fructose, d-mannitol, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose and trehalose. Biolog GN2 results are positive for d-fructose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, pyruvic acid methyl ester, d-glucuronic acid, hydroxy-l-proline, d-serine, urocanic acid, glycerol, α-d-glucose, acetic acid, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, d-gluconic acid, dl-lactic acid, propionic acid and succinic acid, but negative for α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, glycogen, Tween 40, Tween 80, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, adonitol, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, cellobiose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, lactose, lactulose, maltose, melibiose, methyl β-d-glucoside, d-psicose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, turanose, xylitol, succinic acid mono-methyl ester, formic acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-galacturonic acid, d-glucosaminic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, malonic acid, sebacic acid, glucuronamide, l-alaninamide, glycyl l-aspartic acid, l-phenylalanine, l-threonine, dl-carnitine, thymidine, phenylethylamine, 2-aminoethanol, 2,3-butanediol, dl-α-glycerol-phosphate, α-d-glucose 1-phosphate, d-glucose 6-phosphate, d-galactose, m yo-inositol, d-sorbitol, sucrose, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, itaconic acid, succinamic acid, l-alanyl glycine, l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-leucine, l-ornithine, l-serine, uridine and putrescine. Strains may differ in the utilization of i-erythritol, trehalose, β-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, quinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-asparagine, l-histidine, l-proline, l-pyroglutamic acid and γ-aminobutyric acid, which except for α-ketoglutaric acid are negative in the type strain. Utilization of fucose, d-saccharic acid, glutamic acid and inosine is variable in the type strain. API ZYM results are positive for the presence of acid phosphatase, leucine arylamidase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, but negative for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), valine arylamidase, esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase. The predominant fatty acids of the type strain are C16?:?0, summed feature C16?:?1ω7c/iso-C15?:?0 2-OH, C18?:?1 ω7c, C17?:?0 cyclo, C10?:?0 3-OH, C12?:?0, C12?:?0 3-OH and C12?:?0 2-OH, the major polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol (Fig. S4), and the major respiratory quinone is Q9.The type strain is TH39T (=DSM 107390T=LMG 30830T), isolated from refrigerated raw beef. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 58.2?mol% with a genome size of 5.08?Mb. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of this strain is KX186949 and the ENA/GenBank/DDBJ draft genome sequence is UYJA00000000. An additional strain of the species, TH26 (=DSM 107389=LMG 30831), which differed in genome size (5.34?Mb), DNA G+C content and several metabolic traits was isolated from a different sample of refrigerated raw beef.
DMBP00001603	DESCRIPTION OF PSEUDOMONAS CAMPI SP. NOV. Pseudomonas campi (cam'pi. L. gen. n. campi of a field, of grassland). Cells are Gram-stain-negative, aerobic, motile and non-spore forming in nature. Colonies grown on nutrient agar medium as well as on trypticase soya agar medium are round and translucent after 3–4days of incubation at 25 °C. No fluorescent pigment is formed. Cell growth is observed at up to 37 °C, but not at 40 or 4 °C. Optimum temperature for growth is 25 °C. Growth is observed in the presence of 0–2% (w/v) NaCl2 and at the pH range of 6 to 9. Reduces nitrate and nitrite. Positive for oxidase and catalase. In the GEN III test system l-alanine, l-arginine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-malic acid, tween 40, α-hydroxybutyric acid, propionic acid, acetic acid and formic acid are oxidized. A negative reaction is shown for dextrin, maltose, trehalose, cellobiose, gentiobiose, sucrose, turanose, stachysoe, d-raffinose, lactose, melibiose, β-methyl-d-glucoside, d-salicin, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, N-acetyl-β-d-mannosamine, N-acetyl-neuraminic acid, α-d-glucose, d-mannose, d-fructose, d-galactose, 3-methyl glucose, d-fucose, l-fucose, l-rhamnose, inosine, d-sorbitol, d-mannitol, d-arabitol, myo-insitol, glycerol, d-glucose- 6-phosphate, d-fructose-6-phosphate, d-aspartic acid, d- and l-serine, glycl-l-proline, l-pyroglutamic acid, pectin, d-galacturonic acid, l-galactonic acid lactone, d-gluconic acid, d-glucuronic acid, mucic acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, d-lactic acid methyl ester, l-lactic acid, citric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, d-malic acid, bromosuccinic acid, γ-aminobutyric acid, α-ketobutyric acid. Weakly positive results are observed for: gelatine, glucuronamide, methyl pyruvate, β-hydroxy-d, l-butyric acid and acetoacetic acid. It is sensitiv to 1% sodium lactate. Resistance is shown to troleandomycin, rifamycin SV, lincomycin, guanidine HCl (weak), niaproof 4, vancomycin, potassium tellurite and aztreonam (weak), sensitivity to fusidic acid, d-serine, minocycline, nalidixic acid, lithium hloride, sodium butryrate and sodium bromate. In the API 20NE test, indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease, β-glucosidase, protease and β-galactosidase are negative. Assimilation of malic acid is positive whereas negative results are obtained for d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetyl-glucosamine, maltose, potassium gluconate, capric acid, adipic acid, malic acid, trisodium citrate and phenylacetic acid. Positive reaction is shown for esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase. A weak reaction is obtained for valine arylamidase and no reaction for alkaline phosphatase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, α- and β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α- and β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase. Major fatty acids include C18:1 7c, C16 : 1 7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH, and C16:0 , while minor components are C12:0 , C10:0 3-OH, C12:0 3-OH, C17:1 8c, C15:0 and C14:0 .The type strain S1-A32-2T (LMG=31521T=DSM 110222T) was isolated from the top soil of an extensively managed grassland plot in the Schorfheide-Chorin exploratory of the long-term biodiversity research platform in Germany (53° 5′ 14.7′′ N; 13° 58′ 10.7′′ E). The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 63.43%. The genome sequence accession number is CP053697; the 16S rRNA gene accession number is MT415401.
DMBP00001604	 Pseudomonas canadensis (ca.nad.en′sis N.L. fem. adj. canadensis from or originating from Canada, the country where strain 2-92T was isolated).Cells are aerobic, Gram-reaction-negative, non-spore-forming rods (approx. 0.5 µm wide and 2.3 µm long), motile with one or multiple polar flagella. After 48 h on KB, colonies are white-yellowish and circular (average 4 mm in diameter), convex with regular margins and produce fluorescent pigments. Tolerant to different NaCl concentrations up to 4 %, and grows at 4 °C with optimal growth at 30 °C and no growth at 40 °C. Based on Biolog PM1 and PM2A Microplate assays, utilizes N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, succinic acid, l-aspartic acid, l-proline, d-alanine, d-mannose, d-gluconic acid, l-lactic acid, d-mannitol, l-glutamic acid, dl-malic acid, Tween 20, d-fructose, acetic acid, α-d-glucose, l-asparagine, α-ketoglutaric acid, l-glutamine, adenosine, citric acid, fumaric acid, bromosuccinic acid, propionic acid, inosine, l-serine, l-alanine, l-alanyl-glycine, monomethylsuccinate, methylpyruvate, l-malic acid, pyruvic acid, γ-aminobutyric acid, caproic acid, d-glucosamine, β-hydroxybutyric acid, malonic acid, quinic acid, succinamic acid, l-arginine, hydroxy-l-proline, l- isoleucine, l-leucine, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-valine, d,l-carnitine, glycerol, l-arabinose, d-saccharic acid, d-galactose, d-galactonic acid γ-lactone, mucic acid, d-glucosaminic acid and d-arabitol but not lactose, maltose, d-fructose 6-phosphate, α-hydroxyglutaric acid γ-Lactone, glycyl-l-proline, phenylethylamine, 1,2-propanediol, d-glucose 6-phosphate, sebacic acid, Tween 40, Tween 80 or formic acid. Using API 20 NE assays, assimilates potassium gluconate, capric acid, adipic acid and trisodium citrate. Positive for arginine dihydrolase, urease, gelatinase and oxidase but negative for indole production, β-glucosidases and β-galactosidases. The most abundant fatty acids are C16 : 0, C16 : 1ω7c and/or C16 : 1ω6c (summed feature 3) and C18 : 1ω7c and/or C18 : 1ω7c (summed feature 8).The type strain is 2-92T (=DOAB 798T=LMG 28499T), isolated from a soil sample from Woodslee, Ontario, Canada. The DNA G+C content of strain 2-92T is 60.3 mol%.DOI： 10.1099/ijsem.0.001698
DMBP00001605	Pseudomonas cannabina (can.na′bi.na. L. fem. adj. cannabina pertaining to Cannabis, the generic name of the host plant, Cannabis sativa L.).Gram-negative rods that are 1·1–3·0μm wide × 3·0–4·0 μm long and motile by means of one to four polar flagella. Colonies have a grey colour and are slightly convex on YPGA. Metabolism is respiratory. Produces a fluorescent pigment on King B medium. Results of LOP AT tests are +, –, –, – and + (Lelliott et al., 1966). Nitrate is not reduced. No hydrolysis of aesculin or starch. Arginine test (Thornley), indole production and gelatin liquefaction are negative. Assimilates d-glucose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-mannose, d-ribose, glycerol, d-saccharate, mucate, citrate, d-gluconate, l-histidine, l-aspartate, l-glutamate, l-proline, l-alanine and l-serine and does not assimilate the other 83 carbon sources of the Biotype 100 strips (bioMérieux). The DNA G + C content is 60·2 mol%. In nature, pathogenic on Cannabis sativa L. and by inoculation on Phaseolus vulgaris L. The type strain is CFBP 2341T = ICMP 2823T = NCPPB 1437T. 
DMBP00001606	Pseudomonas capsici (cap′si.ci. N.L. neut. gen n. capsici, referring to Capsicum, the genus name of pepper).The colonies are light cream, opaque, round and 1.0–2.0 mm diameter after incubation at 28?°C for 24 h on nutrient agar medium. The cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, motile with multiple polar flagella and rod-shaped (2.4??m long and 0.7??m wide). Strains are levan-negative, oxidase-positive, positive for potato rot activity and arginine-dihydrolase-negative, and induce hypersensitive reactions on tobacco. The cells are fluorescent on King’s B medium under ultraviolet light. Cell growth occurs at 4–37?°C, with optimum growth observed between 28 and 30?°C. The bacterium grows at pH 5–6 and with 1–4% NaCl. The fatty acids comprise summed feature 3 (C16:1?ω7c and/or C16:1?ω6c), C16:?0, summed feature 8 (C18:1?ω7c and/or C18:1?ω6c), C12?:?0, C12?:?0 3-OH, C10:0 3-OH, C12:0 2-OH, 11-methyl C18:1 ω7c and C18?:?0. The bacterium has diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylglycerol as major polar lipids. Biolog GEN III MicroPlate assays show that Pc19-1T can utilize α-d-glucose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, methyl pyruvate, γ-amino-butyric acid, d-fructose, d-arabitol, l-alanine, d-galactose, myo-inositol, d-gluconic acid, l-lactic acid, glycerol, l-aspartic acid, citric acid, d-fucose, l-glutamic acid, glucuronamide, α-keto-glutaric acid, l-fucose, d-fructose-6-PO4, mucic acid, d-malic acid, propionic acid, d-aspartic acid, l-pyroglutamic acid, quinic acid, l-malic acid, acetic acid, inosine, l-serine and d-saccharic acid. Strain Pc19-1T is able to grow in the presence of 1?% sodium lactate, troleandomycin, lincomycin, vancomycin, nalidixic acid, aztreonam, fusidic acid, rifamycin SV, guanidine HC, tetrazolium violet, lithium chloride, d-serine, niaproof 4, tetrazolium blue, potassium tellurite and sodium bromate. Using API 20 NE assays, the bacterium assimilates glucose, arabinose, mannose, mannitol, gluconate, caprate, malate and citrate, and is positive for nitrate reduction to nitrite, urease and β-glucosidase, but negative for indole production, arginine dihydrolase, gelatin hydrolysis, β-galactosidase, assimilation of N-acetyl-glucosamine, maltose, adipate and phenyl-acetate. The type strain, Pc19-1T (=LMG 32209T=CFBP 8884T), was isolated from symptomatic pepper foliage in Georgia, USA in 2019. The genomic DNA G+C content of the type strain is 58.4?mol%.
DMBP00001607	DESCRIPTION OF PSEUDOMONAS CARBONARIA SP. NOV. Pseudomonas carbonaria (car.bo.na'ri.a. L. fem. adj. carbonaria of or relating to charcoal, the source of isolation) Beige colonies (diameter about 2mm) are formed on nutrient agar (NA) at 30°C. Cells are Gram-stain-negative. They are motile, non-spore forming rods, approximately 1µm in width and 2µm in length. Aerobic and oxidase-positive. Good growth occurs after 48h on NA, brain–heart infusion (BHI) agar, tryptic soy broth (TSB) agar, Reasoners 2A agar and MacConkey agar (all Oxoid) at 28°C. Growth occurs on NA at 10–45°C, but not at 8 or 50°C. Cells grow at 28°C in the presence of 1.0–5.0% NaCl. Grows at pH 11.5. Assimilation of capric acid, weak assimilation of trisodium citrate, no assimilation of potassium gluconate, D-glucose, D-mannitol, L-arabinose (API20NE). No acid production from d-glucose, lactose, l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-mannitol, i-inositol, salicin, d-sorbitol, maltose, d-mannose, trehalose, d-xylose, α-methyl-d-glucoside, adonitol, d-arabitol, dulcitol, erythritol, melibiose, raffinose and l-rhamnose. Urease activity, indole production, lysine decarboxylase, arginine dihydrolase, ornithine decarboxylase, alkalinisation of citrate (Simmons), aesculin hydrolysis β-galactosidase (ONPG), production of brown diffusible pigments on tyrosine agar, hydrogen-sulphide production and alkalinization of malonate are all negative. The following compounds are utilized as a sole source of carbon: acetate, dl-lactate, pyruvate, citrate, cis-aconitate, dl-3-hydroxybutyrate, l-alanine, l-aspartate and l-histidine. N-acetylgalactosamine, N-acetylglucosamine, l-arabinose, l-arbutin, cellobiose, d-galactose, gluconate, d-glucose, maltose, d-mannose, melibiose, l-rhamnose, adonitol, maltitol, d-fructose, trehalose, glycerol, d-mannitol, d-ribose, sucrose, salicin, d-xylose, i-inositol, d-sorbitol, trans-aconitate, fumarate, mesaconate, l-serine, putrescine, propionate, adipate, 4-aminobutyrate, azelate, glutarate, itaconate, mesaconate, 2-oxoglutarate, suberate, β-alanine, l-leucine, l-ornithine, l-phenylalanine, l-proline, l-tryptophan, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate and phenylacetate are not utilized. The chromogenic substrates l-alanine-p-nitroanilide and bis-p-nitrophenyl-phosphate are hydrolyzed, the substrates p-nitrophenyl-β-d-glucopyranoside, nitrophenyl-α-d-glucopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl-β-d-glucuronide, p-nitrophenyl-β-d-galactopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl-β-d-xylopyranoside, bis-p-nitrophenyl-phenylphosphonate, 2-deoxythymidine-2′-p-nitrophenyl-phospha te, γ-l-glutamate-p-nitroanilide and l-proline-p-nitroanilide are not hydrolysed. Major fatty acids are C16:0 , summed feature 3 (C16:1 7cand/or C16:1 6c) and summed feature 8 (C18:1 7c and/or C18:1 6c). Hydroxylated fatty acids were C10:0 3-OH and C12:0 3-OH. In the polyamine pattern putrescine, cadaverine and spermidine are the major components. The quinone system contains predominantly ubiquinone Q-9. The polar lipid profile contains major amounts of diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylethanolamine and minor amounts of several unidentified lipids. The type strain Wesi-4T (=DSM 110367T=CIP 111764T=CCM 9017T) was isolated from a powdered charcoal sample of unknown origin in 2012 in Alabama, USA. The GenBank/ EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers of Pseudomonas sp. Wesi- 4T for the 16S rRNA gene is MT947626. The assembled genome sequence is available under the accession number CAJFCI00000000
DMBP00001608	Pseudomonas carboxydohydrogena (Sanjieva and Zavarzin) comb. nov., a Monotrichous, Nonbudding, Strictly Aerobic, Carbon Monoxide-Utilizing Hydrogen Bacterium Previously Assigned to Seliberia | Microbiology Societydoi:Cells of Seliberia carboxydohydrogena DSM 1083 were found to be gram-negative, colorless, motile, and catalase and oxidase positive. Starch, urea, exogenous poly-<beta>-hydroxybutyric acid, agar, and Tween 80 were not hydrolyzed. The bacterium was avirulent for Lycopersicon escu- lentum and was 3-ketolactose-negative whereas the control organism, Agrobacterium tumefaciens 3/3-3, showed tumor formation as well as 3-ketolactose production. Neither meta-hydrox- ybenzoate nor pantothenate was used as a sole source of carbon. In stab cultures supplemented with nutrient broth-yeast extract, glucose, or fructose, growth of S. carboxydohydrogena DSM 1083 occurred exclusively on the agar surface, indicating that growth was strictly dependent on the presence of oxygen.The substrate utilization spectrum of S. carboxydohydrogena DSM 1083 was restricted. Only acetate, pyruvate, lactate, citrate, fuma- rate, malate, and aspartate were used as sole sources of carbon and energy for heterotrophic growth. With the exception of fructose, sucrose, and aspartate, carbohydrates and amino acids, as well as m-hydroxybenzoate and pantothenate, were not utilized. The cells were able to grow autotrophically in a mineral medium under an atmosphere of 40% CO, 10% O2, and 50% N2 at a doubling time (td) of 20 h (30°C) as well as under an atmosphere of 80% H2, 10% 02, and 10% CO2 (td = 7 h). The enzyme system for carbon monoxide utilization was soluble and was formed only during growth with CO; hydrogen- ase was membrane bound and was present in cells grown with CO or with H2 + C02.

DMBP00001611	4.1. Description of P. cedrella sp. nov. ced. re.’lla M. L. fem. gen. n. cedrella, of cedar, the characteristic tree of Lebanon, the country from which isolates were taken. The type strain is CFML 96–198T, and has been deposited in the Collection of the Institut Pasteur as CIP 105541T. The description is based on data for the following strains: CFML 96–198T (= CIP 105541T), CFML 96–214, CFML 96–179, CFML 96–176, CFML 96–209, CFML 96–215, CFML 96–213, CFML 96–187, and CFML 96–203. The G+C content of the DNA is 59 to 60 mol%. 4.1.1. Cell and colonial characteristics Cells are Gram-negative, asporogenous and rod-shaped, motile by means of a single polar flagellum (figure 1). Colonies are smooth on nutrient agar, circular, nonpigmented, and nonhemolytic when grown on blood agar. 4.1.2. Biochemical and physiological characteristics All strains of P. cedrella produce the fluorescent pigment on King B medium as well as on S1 medium [18]. Arginine dihydrolase, catalase, and oxidase are also produced. Significant growth is observed only at low salt concentrations (0.8%), but not at the following upper salinities tested: 5 and 7%. Strains grow at 4 °C. They produce levan from sucrose. Strains fail to grow at 41 °C. Strains lack DNase and lecithinase. Strains do not produce coagulase or elastase. Lysine and ornithine are not decarboxylated. No phenazine pigments are produced on King A medium. The species does not form indole from tryptophan. No phenylalanine desaminase activity is observed. Fibrinolysin, acetoin, and 2,3,5-triphenyltetrazolium chloride test negative. 4.1.3. Assimilation of carbon compounds All strains utilize the following substrates as carbon and energy sources (Biotype-100 system, BioMerieux, 69280 Marcy-l’Etoile, France): α-D(+) glucose, β-D(+) fructose, D(+) galactose, D(+) trehalose, D(+) mannose, D(-) ribose, L(+) arabinose, D(+) xylose, D-lyxose, i-erythritol, D-saccharate, mucate, L(-)malate, trans-aconitate, D-glucuronate, D-galacturonate, 2-keto-D-gluconate, N-acetyl-D-glucosamine, protocatechuate, (-) quinate, betain, putrescine, caprate, caprylate, succinate, fumarate, glutarate, DL-glycerate, D-glucosamine, 3-hydroxybutyrate, D-alanine, malonate, L-tyrosine, α-ketoglutarate. No strains use the following substrates as sole carbon and energy sources: α-D(+) melibiose, sucrose, D(+)raffinose, maltotriose, maltose, α-lactose, lactulose, 1-O-methyl-β-galactopyranoside, 1-O-metyhl-α-galactopyranoside, D(+)cellobiose, β-gentiobiose, 1-O-methyl-β-D-glucopyranoside, palatinose, α-L(-) fucose, D(+) melezitose, dulcitol, D-tagatose, maltitol, D(+) turanose, 1-O-methyl-α-D-glucopyranoside, 3-Omethyl-D-glucopyranose, L(+) tartrate, tricarballylate, 5-keto-D-gluconate, phenylacetate, gentisate, 3-hydroxybenzoate, benzoate, 3-phenylpropionate, m-coumarate, trigonelline, histamine, itaconate. 4.1.4. Enzymatic tests (APIZYM system, biomerieux) The following enzymatic activities have been recorded: esterase-lipase (C8), trypsine. No enzymatic activity has been observed for the following enzymes: lipase (C14), β-glucosidase.doi:
DMBP00001614	Pseudomonas cerasi sp. nov. (non Griffin, 1911) (ce.ra'si.  L. gen. n. cerasi of cherry tree, referring the isolation source of most of strains, diseased sour cherry Prunus cerasus. Gram-negative, strictly aerobic, non-spore-forming rod-shaped cells (0.5x2-3.5 μm).  After 48h of incubation an 26 °C on NAS (Nutrient Agar with 5% of sucrose) medium the colonies are mucoid, convex (dome-shaped), shiny, pearly- white because of levan production.  A diffusible fluorescent pigment is produced on King's B medium.  Growth occurs at 5 °C but not at 37 °C.  NaCI is tolerated at concentrations up to 5% (w/v).  Strains are able to induce hypersensitive reaction on tobacco leaves cv.  Samsun after 24h, are positive for catalase, gelatin liquefaction, tyrosine activity and L-lactic acid.  Strains are oxidase-negative, arginine dihydrolase-negative, are not pectinolytic and do not hydrolyze aesculin and tartaric acid. Strains are able to utilize sucrose, a-D-glucose, D-mannose, D-galactose, 1% sodium lactate, D-sorbitol, D-mannitol, D-arabitol, glycerol, L-alanine, L-aspartic acid, L-glutamic acid, Lserine, pectin, D-gluconic acid, D-glucuronic acid, mucic acid, quinic acid, D-saccharic acid, L-lactic acid, citric acid, D-malic acid, L-malic acid, y-amino-butryric acid and acetic acid. Do not utilize D-maltose, D-trehalose, gentiobiose, D-turanose, stachyose, D-raffinose, a-Dlactose, β-methyl-D-glucoside, D-salicin, N-acetyl-D-glucosamine, inosine, fusidic acid, minocycline, L-galactonic acid lactone, p-hydroxy-phenylacetic acid, a-hydroxy-butyric acid and sodium butyrate.  Strains were positive for growth in the presence of rifamycin SV, lincomycin, niaproof 4, vancomycin, tetrazolium violet, tetrazolium blue, potassium tellurite, but did not grow in presence of nalidixic acid, lithium chloride and sodium bromate.  The most abundant fatty acids are: 16:0 and summed feature 3 (16:1 7c/ 15:0 iso 20H).The type strain 58T (= LMG 28609 = CFBP 8305) was isolated from leaves of sour cherry with necrotic spots collected on Studzianek near Babsk (Fig. S7) in Poland. The DNA G +C content of the type strain is 59%.DOI:
DMBP00001615	Pseudomonas chengduensis (cheng.du.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. chengduensis pertaining to Chengdu, where the type strain was isolated).Cell are Gram-stain-negative, facultatively anaerobic, non-motile, straight rods, 1.1–1.8 µm long and 0.4–0.5 µm wide. Colonies are circular and white with entire edges. Able to grow at pH 6.0–10.0, at 4–42 °C and in the presence of 0–8 % NaCl. Positive for catalase, oxidase, nitrate reduction, production of arginine dihydrolase, gelatin, H2S and indole, and hydrolysis of Tweens 20, 40 and 80, but negative for hydrolysis of casein. In the Biolog GN system (GENIII), positive for utilization of d-fucose, l-serine, d-fructose, l-alanine, l-arginine, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-lactic acid, citric acid, l-malic acid, propionic acid, γ-aminobutryric acid, acetic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, d-salicin, α-d-glucose, glycyl l-proline, l-aspartic acid, pectin, d-galacturonic acid, l-galactonic acid lactone, d-gluconic acid, d-glucuronic acid, glucuronamide, mucic acid, d-saccharic acid, methyl pyruvate, bromosuccinic acid, acetoacetic acid and formic acid. Negative for utilization of the following carbon sources: dextrin, maltose, trehalose, cellobiose, gentiobiose, sucrose, turanose, stachyose, raffinose, α-lactose, melibiose, methyl β-d-glucoside, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, N-acetyl-β-d-mannosamine, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, 3-methyl glucose, N-acetyl neuraminic acid, l-fucose, l-rhamnose, inosine, d-serine, d-sorbitol, d-arabitol, myo-inositol, d-glucose 6-phosphate, d-aspartic acid, β-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, d-lactic acid methyl ester, d-mannose, d-galactose, fusidic acid, d-mannitol, glycerol, d-fructose 6-phosphate, quinic acid, d-malic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxy-dl-butyric acid and α-ketobutyric acid. The predominant fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c/C18 : 1ω6c, C16 : 0 and C16 : 1ω7c/C16 : 1ω6c. The predominant ubiquinone is Q-9.The type strain is MBRT ( = CGMCC 2318T = DSM 26382T), isolated from landfill leachate, in Chengdu solid-waste disposal site in Sichuan, China. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 61.9 mol%.
DMBP00001616	chlo.ro.ra’phis. Gr. adj.chlorus green; Gr. n. raphis a needle; M.L.fem. n. chlororaphis a green needle.Fluorescent pigment is produced. Even though thespecies name refers to the production of the green insolublephenazine pigment chlororaphin, which often is excretedand crystallizes around the colonies, P. chlororaphis has beenfound to be closely related to P. aureofaciens Kluyver (whichdoes not produce this pigment, but instead makes anotherphenazine pigment that is orange and freely diffuses intothe medium. The relationship between the two species wasdemonstrated by a high DNA similarity as determined byDNA–DNA hybridization (Palleroni et al., 1972; Johnson andPalleroni, 1989). For this reason, P. chlororaphis may includetwo subspecies: subsp. chlororaphis, producing chlororaphin,and subsp. aureofaciens, which produces the water-solublephenazine monocarboxylic acid. Other phenotypic properties that differentiate the two subspecies are the utilizationof L-arabinose and α-amylamine by subsp. aureofaciens, andof D-alanine by subsp. chlororaphis. Optimum temperature,about 30?C. The type strain of P. chlororaphis subsp. chlororaphis was isolated from dead larvae of the cockchafer (alarge European beetle). Strains of this subspecies and ofsubsp. aureofaciens have been isolated from various sources,including water. The first strain of subsp. aureofaciens (ATCC13985, NCIB 9030) was isolated from clay suspended inkerosene for 3 weeks (Kluyver, 1956).The mol% G + C of the DNA is: 63.5 (Bd).Type strain: ATCC 9446, DSM 50083, IFO 3904, NRRLB-560, NCIB 9392.GenBank accession number (16S rRNA): D86004, Z76657.
DMBP00001621	ci.cho’ri.i. Gr. pl.cichora succory, chicory; L. n.cichoriumchicory;M.L. gen. n. cichorii of chicory.Selected characteristics of the species are given in Tables 8and 11. A fluorescent pigment is produced. The oxidase reaction is weak and slow and the gelatinase reaction is negative.Optimum temperature, ?30?C. Isolated from Cichorium intybus and C. endivia, for which it is pathogenic.The mol% G + C of the DNA is: 59 (Bd).Type strain: ATCC 10857, DSM 50259, LMG 2162, NCPPB943, PDDCC 5707.GenBank accession number (16S rRNA): Z76658.
