DMBP00001725	DESCRIPTION OF PSEUDOMONAS NEUROPATHICA SP. NOV.Pseudomonas neuropathica (neu.ro.pa'thi.ca. Gr. neut. n. neuron, nerve; Gr. neut. n. pathos, disease; N.L. fem. adj. neuropathica, associated with neurological symptoms).Cells are aerobic, Gram-negative, rod-­­shaped (2.5–1.1 µm long, 0.5–0.4 µm wide), lophotrichous flagellation and oxidase-­positive. Colonies on King B agar are round, flat, opaque, beige-coloured and mucoid with regular margins, and are approximately 5 mm in diameter after growth for 2 days at 30 °C. Fluorescein pigment is produced, but pyocyanin is not. Bacterial growth occurs at 4–37 °C and pH 7–9.  Cells tolerate 0–4.5 % NaCl. The strain is β-Haemolytic. In the API 20NE test, strains are positive for the presence of arginine dihydrolase, hydrolysis of gelatine, and the assimilation of glucose, arabinose, mannose, mannitol, N-­acetyl-­d-glucosamine, gluconate, caprate, malate and citrate. Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite. Plate test analysis performed using the Biolog GEN III system indicate that these strains have the ability to oxidize a variety of carbon sources: α-d­­glucose, Tween 40, d-­mannose, d-­mannitol, γ-amino-­butyric acid, d-­fructose, d-­arabitol, l-­alanine, trehalose, d-­galactose, l-­arginine, d-­gluconic acid, l-­lactic acid, β-hydroxy-d,l-butyric acid, glycogen, l-­aspartic acid, citric acid, N-­acetyl-d-­glucosamine,  l-­glutamic acid, glucuronamide, α-keto glutaric acid, l-­histidine, mucic acid, d-­malic acid, propionic acid, quinic acid, l-­malic acid, acetic acid, inosine, l-­serine and d-­saccharic acid. Strains are able to grow in the presence of 1 % sodium lactate, troleandomycin, lincomycin, vancomycin, nalidixic acid, aztreonam, fusidic acid, rifamycin SV, guanidine HCL, tetrazolium violet, minocycline, niaproof 4, tetrazolium blue and potassium tellurite. Other tests produce negative or weak results. The predominant cellular fatty acids include C16 : 0 (38.4 %), summed feature 3 (C16 : 1 ω7c and/or C16 : 1 ω6c, 24.6 %), C17 : 0 cyclo (11.6 %), summed feature 8 (C18 : 1 ω6c and/or C18 : 1 ω7c, 7.7 %), C12 : 0 (5.4 %), C12 : 0-­3OH (4.7 %) and C10 : 0-­3OH (4.2 %) (Table 5).The type strain is P155T (=CCUG 74875 T=CECT 30178T), isolated from Oncorhynchus mykiss. The DNA G+C base content is 59.23 mol%. The whole-­genome shotgun project for strain P155T has been deposited in the DDBJ/ENA/GenBank databases under the accession number JACOPX000000000. The version described in this paper is the first version. The 16S rRNA gene sequence of the type strain is available under the accession number LR797590.1
DMBP00001726	DESCRIPTION OF PSEUDOMONAS NICOSULFURONEDENS SP. NOV. Pseudomonas nicosulfuronedens (ni.co.sul.fu.ron.e'dens. N.L. neut. n. nicosulfuronum nicosulfuron; L. v. edo to eat; N.L. part. adj. nicosulfuronedens eating nicosulfuron). Cells are Gram-stain-negative, aerobic, nicosulfuron-degrading, rod-shaped, 0.3–0.7µm wide, 1.2–1.7µm long and motile by one or two flagella. Catalase-positive and oxidase-positive. The growth is observed at 20–35°C (optimum, 30°C) and pH 5.0–10.0 (optimum, pH 6.0) and in the presence of 0–4.0 %NaCl (optimum, 2.0%). Positive for nitrate reduction, L-arginine; negative for indole production, d-glucose fermentation and hydrolysis of starch, Tweens (20, 40, 60 and 80), urea and gelatin. Utilizes d-glucose, gluconate, capric acid, adipic acid, malic acid, citrate and phenylacetic acid as sole organic carbon sources; does not utilize d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetyl-glucosamine, maltose, erythritol, d-ribose, d-xylose, l-xylose, d-adonitol, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-galactose, d-fructose, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, N-acetyl-glucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, glycogen, xylitol, gentiobiose, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, potassium gluconate, potassium 5-ketogluconate and potassium 2-ketogluconate as sole organic carbon sources. The major fatty acids are C16:0, C17:0 cyclo and anteiso C15:0 . The respiratory quinone is ubiquinone Q-9. The main polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidyle_x0002_thanolamine and aminophospholipid. Moderate amounts of unidentified polar lipids are also detected. The type strain is LAM1902T (=JCM 33860T=KCTC 72830T), isolated from a nicosulfuron-degrading microbial consortium. The GenBank accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of strain LAM1902T is MN007089. The GenBank accession number for the draft genome sequence of strain LAM1902T is SWDV00000000. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 64.8mol%.
DMBP00001727	Pseudomonas nitritireducens Gr. n. nitriti, nitrite; L. part. adj. reducens, drawing backwards, bringing back to a state or condition; N.L. part. adj. nitritireducens, nitrite reducing.Strain cells are Gram-negative, rod-shaped bacterium. Colonies are opalescent, opaque, lackluster, moist, circular and about 1 mm in diameter after 48-h incubation at 30 °C. Cells are motile weakly by single polar flagella. It grows well in the presence NaCl of 0–6 % (w/v) (optimum at 0–4 %), at 15–40 °C (optimum at 25–30 °C) and pH 4–12 (optimum at pH 8.0). Utilization of glucose, fructose, galactose, lactic acid, malic acid, acetic acid, citric acid, cysteine, Leucine, histidine, phenylalanine, methionine, isoleucine, tryptophan, cystine. Non-utilization of sucrose, lactose, maltose, xylose, sorbose, raffinose, rhamnose, cellobiose, arabinose, dextrine, mannitol, myo-inositol, sorbitol, oxalic acid, tartaric acid, Alanine, glutamic acid, aminoacetic acid, l-arginine, dl-asparagine, serine, l-threonine, l-Lysine. Positive for oxidase, catalase, urease, denitrification, aerobic nitrite and nitrate reduction, and H2S production. Negative for phenylalanine deaminase, VP and MR test. Non-hydrolysis of gelatin, starch, Tween 80. Sensitive to amikacin, piperacillin, ciprofloxacin, tetracycline, gentamicin. Resistant to roxithromycin, clindamycin, penicillin G, sulfamethoxazole, amoxicillin, chloramphenicol, bacitracin, erythromycin, vancomycin, ampicillin, azithromycin, rifampicin, novobiocin. The major fatty acids present include C16:0 (28.55 %), C16:1ω6c or C16:1ω7c (20.94 %), C18:1ω7c (17.21 %) and C18:0 (13.73 %). The respiratory quinine is Q-9. The DNA G+C content is 62.0 mol%. The type strain is WZBFD3-5A2T (=CGMCC 1.10702T = LMG 25966T). 
DMBP00001728	 Pseudomonas nitrititolerans (ni.tri.ti.to′le.rans. N.L. neut. n. nitritum nitrite; L. pres. part. tolerans tolerating; N.L. part. adj. nitrititolerans tolerating nitrite).Cells are Gram-stain-negative, non-spore-forming, rod-shaped, 0.7–1.1 µm wide, 1.4–2.0 µm long and motile by means of one single polar flagellum. Chemoorganotrophic, facultatively anaerobic, oxidase-positive and catalase-positive. Growth is observed at 4–42 °C (optimum, 30–37 °C) and pH 6.0–11.0 (pH 8.0–9.0) and in the presence of 0–9.0 % (w/v) NaCl (, 1.0–2.0 %). Positive for nitrate reduction; negative for H2S and indole production, d-glucose fermentation, and hydrolysis of casein, Tweens (20, 40, 60 and 80), l-tyrosine, carboxymethyl cellulose, l-arginine, urea and gelatin. Utilizes glycerol, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, maltose, starch, d-arabitol, potassium gluconate, potassium 5-ketogluconate, capric acid, malic acid and trisodium citrate as sole organic carbon sources; does not utilize erythritol, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, l-xylose, d-adonitol, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-galactose, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, N-acetyl-glucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, d-cellobiose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, glycogen, xylitol, gentiobiose, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, l-arabitol, potassium 2-ketogluconate, adipic acid and phenylacetic acid as sole organic carbon sources. Positive for esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase; negative for alkaline phosphatase, lipase (C14), chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase. The major fatty acids are summed feature 8 (C18 : 1  ω7c/C18 : 1  ω6c), C16 : 0, summed feature 3 (C16 : 1  ω7c/C16 : 1  ω6c), C17 : 0 cyclo and C12 : 0. The respiratory quinone is ubiquinone Q-9. The major polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol.The type strain is GL14T (=CGMCC 1.13874T=NBRC 113853T), isolated from a nitrification/denitrification bioreactor. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of strain GL14T is MH917718. The Whole Genome Shotgun project of strain GL14T has been deposited at DDBJ/ENA/GenBank under the accession number RFFL00000000. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 63.1 mol%. 
DMBP00001729	"ni.tro.re.du'cens. L. n. nitrum nitate; L. v. reduco to draw backwards, bring back to a state or condition; M.L. part. adj. nitroreducens nitrate reducing.The following description is taken from the originalpaper.Rods, 0.4-0.6 x 1.4-1.8 μm, occurring singly, rarely in pairs; motile with polar flagella. Fluorescent pigment produced. Gelatin is not liquefied. Nitrates are reduced to nitrites and to gas. Oxidase reaction positive. H,S not produced. Starch is not hydrolyzed. Acid is produced from glucose. Glucose, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate, citrate, succinate, ethanol, p-hydroxybenzoate, and protocatechuate can be utilized as sole carbon sources. 5-Ketogluconate, benzoate, salicylate, gentisate, anthranilate, and p-aminobenzoate are not utilized. The fresh isolate could utilize kerosene, but the activity was lost after subcultivation in the laboratory.""Optimum growth temperature, 25-30°C. No growth at 37°C.The source of isolation was oil brine in Japan.The species has two characteristics never found in association in any of the fluorescent species described in RNA group I, namely, the capacity for denitrification and the inability to utilize gelatin. Its assignment to the genus Pseudomonas has been confirmed by molecular studies (Anzai et al., 1997).The mol% G + C of the DNA is: unknown.Type strain: IAM 1439.GenBank accession number (16S rRNA): D84021."
DMBP00001730	 Pseudomonas nosocomialis (no.so.co.mi.a'lis. L. neut. n. nosocomium, a hospital, infirmary; L. masc. or fem. suff. -alis, suffix used with the sense of pertaining to; N.L. fem. adj. nosocomialis, pertaining to a hospital).Cells are aerobic, Gram-stain-negative, aerobic, rod-shaped (4.8–5.4 µm long, 0.7–0.8 µm wide), motile with single polar flagellum and oxidase positive. Colonies cultured on LB medium are beige coloured, with irregular shape, hard, dry and tenaciously coherent (2–10 mm of diameter). Non-pigmented. Growth occurs in NB with 0–8 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 2–4 %), at pH from 5 to 10 (optimum, pH 7–9) and at a temperature of 6–44 °C (optimum, 37 °C) tested in LB. In the API 20NE test, it is positive for nitrate reduction and the assimilation of arabinose, glucose, mannitol, gluconate, caprate, malate and citrate. Negative results are obtained for indole production, glucose fermentation, presence of arginine dihydrolase, urease, β-glucosidase (hydrolysis of aesculin), protease (hydrolysis of gelatin), β-galactosidase and assimilation of mannose, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, adipate and phenylacetate. Plate test analysis performed using the Biolog GEN III system indicates that these strains have the ability to oxidize a variety of carbon sources: dextrin, maltose, trehalose, α-d-glucose, d-fructose, d-galactose, inosine, d-mannitol, d-arabitol, glycogen, d-fructose-6-PO4, d-serine, l-alanine, l-arginine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-serine, d-galacturonic acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-gluconic acid, d-glucuronic acid, glucuronamide, mucic acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, p-hydroxy-phenylacetic acid, methyl pyruvate, l-lactic acid, citric acid, α-keto glutaric acid, d-malic acid, l-malic acid, bromo-succinic acid, Tween 40, γ-amino-butyric acid, α-hydroxy butyric acid, β-hydroxy-d,l butyric acid, α-keto-butyric acid, propionic acid, acetic acid and formic acid; and able to tolerate pH 6, pH 5, 1 % NaCl, 4 % NaCl, 8 % NaCl, 1 % sodium lactate, fusidic acid, d-serine, troleandomycin, rifamycin SV, minocycline, lincomycin, guanidine HCl, Niaproof 4, vancomycin, tetrazolium violet, tetrazolium blue, nalidixic acid, lithium chloride, potassium tellurite, aztreonam, sodium butyrate, l-fucose, glycyl-l-proline and acetoacetic acid. The predominant cellular fatty acids include summed feature 8, C16 : 0, summed feature 3 and C12 : 0.The type strain is A31/70T (=CECT 9881T=CCUG 73638T), isolated from human clinical specimen. The DNA G+C base composition is 65.5 mol%.The Whole Genome Shotgun projects for strains A31/70T, CCUG 58779 and SD129 have been deposited in DDBJ/ENA/GenBank under the accession numbers QLAE00000000, QLAF00000000 and QLAG00000000, respectively. The version described in this paper is the first version, QLAE01000000, QLAF01000000 and QLAG01000000.DOI： 10.1099/ijsem.0.003628
DMBP00001731	o.le.o'vo.rans.  L. n. oleum oil;  L. v. voro to destroy, consume;  M.L.part.  adj. oleovorans oil consuming. Description taken from the original paper. When grown on agar, the cells are almost coccoid (0.5 x 0.8 μm), but the length increases to about 1.5 um during the exponential phase in broth.  The colonies have a typical fluorescence that is not imparted to the medium.  Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.  Gelatin not liquefied.  Starch is hydrolyzed. Isolated from oil-water emulsions used as lubricants and cooling agents in the cutting and grinding of metals.  Apparently the organism lives on some normal constituent of the cutting compound, probably the naphthenic acids, which act as emulsifying agents.  Consequently, the name oleovorans may not be appropriate.  Allocation to the genus Pseudomonas was confirmed by DNA-rRNA hybridization studies (De Vos etal. , 1989) and by 16S rRNA sequence analysis (Moore et al., 1996;Anzai et al., 1997). The mol% G+ C of the DNA is: 63.5 (T).Type strain: ATCC 8062, DSM 1045. GenBank accession number (16S rRNA): 276665.
DMBP00001734	ori.  en' ta.  lis M. L. masc.  Adj. orientalispertaining to the Orient.  The type strain is CFML 96-170T, and has been deposited in the Collection of the Institut Pasteur as CIP 105540T. The description is based on data of the following strains: CFML 96-170T (= CIP 105540T),CFML 96-164, CFML 96-167, CFML 96-178,CFML 96-166, and CFML 96-174.  The G+C content of the DNA is 60 mol%.4.2.1.  Cell and colonial characteristicsCells are Gram-negative, asporogenous, and rod-shaped.  They appear to be motile and a single polar flagellum was observed (figure 2).When grown on nutrient agar, colonies are smooth, circular, and nonpigmented.4.2.2. Biochemical and physiological characteristics The fluorescent pigment is produced on both King B and S1 medium [18]. Strains are positive in catalase, oxidase, and urease. They are able to grow at low temperature (4 °C) and also at low salt concentration (0.8%). Levan is produced from sucrose. In anaerobic conditions, cells are able to hydrolyze arginine by arginine dihydrolase. Cetrimide is assimilated. No growth is reported at high salt concentrations (5 and 7%).No phenazine pigment production occurs on King A medium. All strains reduced nitrate to nitrite but were not able to denitrify. Strains fail to decarboxylase lysine and ornithine. Indole and acetoin reactions are negative. No growth occurs at 41 °C. The 2,3,5-triphenyltetrazolium chloride test (TTC) is negative. Cells do not possess the following enzymatic activities: coagulase, elastase, DNase, or phenylalanine desaminase.4.2.3. Assimilation of carbon compoundsAll strains utilize the following substrates as carbon and energy sources (Biotype-100 system, BioMerieux): a-D(+) glucose, β-D(+) fructose, D(+) galactose, D(+) trehalose, D(+) mannose, D(-) ribose, L(+) arabinose, D(+) xylose, D(+)arabitol, L(-) arabitol, xylitol, myo-inositol, D-mannitol, D-sorbitol, adonitol, D-saccharate, mucate, L(-) malate, trans-aconitate, D-glucuronate, D-galacturonate, 2-keto-D-gluconate,protocatechuate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, (-) quinate, trigonelline, betain, caprate, caprylate, succinate, fumarate, glutarate, DL-glycerate, ethanolamine, D-glucosamine, 3-hydroxybutyrate, D-alanine, L-serine, malonate, L-tyrosine, a-ketoglutarate.Strains are unable to assimilate the following substrates: a-D(+) melibiose, D(+) raffinose, maltotriose, maltose, a-lactose, lactulose, 1-Omethyl-B-galactopyranoside, 1-O-methyl-agalactopyranoside, D(+) cellobiose, β-gentiobiose, 1-O-methyl-B-D-glucopyranoside, palatinose, a-L(-) fucose, D(+) melezitose, dulcitol, D-tagatose, maltitol, D(+) turanose, D-lyxose, i-erythritol, 1-O-methyl-a-D-glucopyranoside, 3-O-methyl-D-glucopyranose, L(+) tartrate, D(+) tartrate, meso-tartrate, tricarballylate, 5-keto-D-gluconate, phenylacetate, gentisate, 3-hydroxybenzoate, benzoate, 3-phenylpropionate, m-coumarate, histamine, 5-aminovalerate, tryptamine4.2.4. Enzymatic tests (APIZYM system, BioMerieux) All strains possess the following enzymatic activities: esterase-lipase (Cg), trypsine, phosphatase acid.No strain possesses the following enzymatic activities: lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-βglucosaminidase.Strains of P. cedrella and P. orientalis were isolated from Lebanese spring waters. No clinical significance is known.Résumé -Etude taxinomique des souches bactériennes isolées d'eaux de source libanaises : proposition de Pseudomonas cedrella sp. nov et P. orientalis sp. nov. L'hybridation ADN-ADN (méthode àla nucléase S1) a montré que 15 souches, isolées de trois eaux de sources libanaises, appartenant au genre Pseudomonas, forment deux groupes génomiques avec un taux d'hybridation au sein du groupe.allant de 70 à 100 %. Ces deux groupes sont nommésP. cedrella sp. nov. et P. orientalis sp. nov. Ces souchesétaient antérieurement groupées sur la base d'uneanalyse numérique dans les phénons Ve, Vd, Vg et VI. Le taux d'hybridation ADN-ADN avec 65 souches représentant 24 espèces du genre Pseudomonas sensu stricto est inférieur à 50 %. La valeur la plus élévée est notée avec l'espèce P. marginalis. La comparaison des séquences de l'ARNr 16S des souches représentant les deux groupes génomiques (CFML 96-198T et CFML 96-1707) avec les autres séquences des especes du genre Pseudomonas montre que ces deux souches se positionnent dans le groupe intragénique de ?P. fluorescens ?. Le GC% de P. cedrella CIP 105541T et de P. orientalis CIP 105540T est de 59 et 60 mol% respectivement. Les deux espèces peuvent être différenciées entre elles puisque P. cedrella hydrolyse l'érythritol et le D-lyxose. P. cedrella regroupe neuf souches provenant de trois groupes phénotypiques, Ve, Vg, et VI. P. orientalis regroupe six souches de deux groupes phénotypiques, Vd et Ve. O Elsevier, ParisPseudomonas / taxinomie / eau de source / hybridation ADN-ADN / ARNr 16S
DMBP00001735	Colonies on 0.5% glucose nutrient agar are smooth or wrinkled, entire or erose, flat to convex, light yellow, and 2 mm in diameter after 2 days of incubation at 30°C. A pellicle is formed on the surface of 0.5% glucose nutrient broth. A water-insoluble yellow pigment is produced. No water-soluble fluorescent pigment is produced. Growth occurs on MacConkey agar and SS agar.Metabolism is strictly respiratory. Oxidative, but not fermentative. Catalase is produced. Oxidase is not produced. Nitrate is reduced to nitrite (succinate-nitrate medium). Nitrate respiration is negative. Urease is produced. Indole and hydrogen sulfide are not produced. Starch, Tween 80, esculin, and ONPG are not hydrolyzed. Gelatin is not hydrolyzed. Acid and alkaline phosphatases, lysine and ornithine decarboxylases, phenylalanine deaminase, and arginine dihydrolase are not produced. Gluconate is not oxidized. Good growth occurs on Simmons citrate agar. Growth occurs in medium containing 6.5% NaCl. Growth occurs at 42°C. Methionine is not required for growth. Cleavage of protocatechuate is of the ortho type. Agar is not decomposed. Acid is produced from l-arabinose, d-xylose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, d-galactose, maltose, trehalose, mannitol, sorbitol, and inositol oxidatively, but not from l-rhamnose, sucrose, lactose, cellobiose, adonitol, salicin, or inulin. l-Arabinose, d-xylose, d-ribose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, d-galactose, maltose, trehalose, mannitol, glycerol, acetate, pyruvate, malonate, dl-β-n-hydroxybutyrate, fumarate, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate, succinate, p-hydroxybenzoate, and glutamate are utilized, but sucrose, lactose, raffinose, insulin, starch, phenol, o-hydroxybenzoate, and m-hydroxybenzoate are not utilized. Hydrogen is not utilized.The DNA base composition is 65.1 mol% G+C (as determined by the thermal denaturation method).The cellular fatty acids consist of large amounts of even-numbered straight-chain C18:1 acid, C16:0 acid, and C16:1 acid, and small amounts of even-numbered straight-chain C12:0 acid, 3-OH-C 10:0 acid, 3-OH-C12:0 acid, and 2-OH-C12:0 acid.The ubiquinone is ubiquinone Q-9.The cytochrome difference spectra do not show absorption at 551 to 554 and 522 to 524 nm.The type strain is strain KS0036 (= L-l = AJ 2197 = IAM 1568 = JCM 2592), which was isolated from a rice paddy by Iizuka and Komagata in 1963.The description given above is based on the characteristics of type strain KS0036, and variations in the characteristics among the strains of the species are shown in Tables 1 through 4 and 6.doi:
DMBP00001736	Pseudomonas otitidis (o.ti′ti.dis. Gr. n. ous, otos ear; N.L. suff. -itis, -idis used in names of inflammations; N.L. gen. n. otitidis of inflammation of the ear).Cells are Gram-negative, motile rods. Colonies on trypticase soy agar are circular, concave and non-pigmented. Colonies grown on trypticase soy agar supplemented with 5 % sheep blood are not Haemolytic. Growth occurs at 7–45 °C, pH 5–10 and in the presence of up to 4 % NaCl. Colonies typically do not produce fluorescent pigment, and all strains are positive for oxidase and catalase, but negative for urease. Tween 80 and gelatin are hydrolysed, but casein and aesculin are not. Utilizes glycogen, α-d-glucose, acetic acid, citric acid, formic acid, lactic acid, propionic acid, succinic acid, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-arginine, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-leucine, l-ornithine, l-proline, l-serine, γ-aminobutyric acid, phenylethylamine and putrescine. None of the strains utilizes N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, adonitol, d-arabitol, l-arabinose, i-erythritol, myo-inositol, glycerol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, xylitol, d-fructose, l-fucose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, α-d-lactose, maltose, d-mannose, d-melibiose, d-raffinose, l-rhamnose, sucrose, d-trehalose, turanose, d-xylose, d-galacturonic acid, d-gluconic acid, d-glucuronic acid, itaconic acid, glucuronamide, l-phenylalanine, d-serine, inosine, uridine, thymidine, cytosine or sebacic acid. The predominant cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1 ω7c, C16 : 0, C12 : 0, C12 : 0 3-OH and C10 : 0 3-OH. Susceptible to aminoglycosides, fluoroquinolones and polymyxin B, but resistant to piperacillin, erythromycin, tetracycline, chloramphenicol, trimethoprim and sulfamethoxazole. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 67·9 mol%.The type strain, MCC10330T (=ATCC BAA-1130T=DSM 17224T), and other strains were isolated from the ears of patients with acute otitis externa, acute otitis media with otorrhoea and chronic suppurative otitis media.  The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of MCC10330T is AY953147.
DMBP00001737	Cells are Gram-negative, strictly aerobic, motile by a monopolar flagellum, non-spore-forming, short, rod-shaped, 0.5–0.9 μm in width and 1.0–3.5 μm in length. The growth of strain F51T was observed at 4–37 °C (optimal temperature, 28 °C), pH 5.0–8.5 (optimal pH, 7.5) and 0–6.0% (w/v) NaCl (optimal concentration, 2.0%). Positive for catalase, alkaline phosphatase, leucine aminopeptidase, valine aminopeptidase, acid phosphatase, citrate utilization and the Voges–Proskauer test and negative for esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), cystine aminopeptidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase, α-fucosidase, reduction of nitrate to nitrite, indole production, d-glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease, gelatin hydrolysis, H2S production, citrate utilization, lysine decarboxylase and ornithine decarboxylase or tryptophan deaminase, as shown in Table S2. Assimilates d-fructose, d-galactose, α-d-glucose, m-inositol, d-mannose, pyruvic acid methyl ester, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-gluconic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, dl-lactic acid, d-saccharic acid, l-alanine, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-proline, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-serine, 2-aminoethanol, 2-ketogluconate and 5-ketogluconate as single-carbon sources. Acid production is derived from l-arabinose, d-adonitol, d-xylitol, d-galactonic acid, d-glucose, d-fructose, inositol, d-fucose and potassium gluconate. The principal fatty acids are C16:0, summed feature 3 (iso-C15:0 2-OH and/or C16:1ω7c) and summed feature 8 (C18:1ω7c and/or C18:1ω6c) and C10:0 3-OH. The respiratory quinone is Q-9. The polar lipid profile of the strain is composed of diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, two unidentified glycolipids, three unidentified phospholipids and an unidentified aminophosphoglycolipid. The DNA G+C content of the strain is 61.9 mol%.The type strain, F51T (=?KCTC 62133T?=?MCCC 1K03458T), was isolated from the skin of the tail of farmed Murray cod (Maccullochella peelii peelii) with a profound ulceration collected from the town of Dajing (28°41′N, 121°14′E), Yueqing City, Zhejiang Province, China.
DMBP00001738	Pseudomonas palleroniana (pal.le.ron.i.a«na. N.L. fem. adj. palleroniana pertaining to N. J. Palleroni, the famous microbiologist). Gram-negative, motile, non-spore-forming rods. Forms typical white-cream colonies, 3–4 mm in diameter after incubation on YBGA at 28 °C. Produces a fluorescent pigment on King’s medium B. Shares the same characteristics as those described above for P. salomonii except for the results of assimilation of adonitol, xylitol, L-arabitol and 5-ketogluconate, which are negative. Assimilation is variable for isobutyrate, D-hydroxybenzoate, L-methionine, L-lysine and tryptamine. The G¬C content of the DNA of the type strain, CFBP 4389T, is 60.2 mol%. The hypersensitive reaction on tobacco leaves is negative. The strains are either weakly pathogenic or non-pathogenic on rice. The type strain is strain CFBP 4389T (=ICMP 14253T=NCPPB 4278T)
DMBP00001739	Pseudomonas panacis (pa′na.cis. L. gen. n. panacis of panax, a fabulous plant supposed to heal all diseases, and the botanical genus name of ginseng).Gram-negative, aerobic, rod-shaped and motile with one or more flagella. Catalase- and oxidase-positive. Colonies on NA are flat, translucent, butyraceous, beige-coloured with entire margins and usually 2–3 mm in diameter within 2 days at 30 °C. Spores are not formed. Grows between 4 and 35 °C, but not at 37 °C. Tolerates NaCl up to 5 % on NA. Very poor growth detected under anaerobic conditions created by an anaerobic chamber (CO2/H2/N2, 10 : 10 : 80). Produces fluorescent pigment on King's B medium. Reduces nitrate to nitrite and decomposes gelatin. Produces aesculin and arginine dihydrolases, but not urease, H2S, indole or acetone. Produces acid from d-glucose, d-sucrose, d-melibiose and d-arabinose, but not from d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, inositol or amygdalin. Produces alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, valine arylamidase and acid phosphatase, but not lipase (C14), α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase, α-fucosidase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase or tryptophan deaminase. Naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-chymotrypsin are weakly produced. Utilizes the following substrates as sole carbon and energy sources: glucose, arabinose, mannose, mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, gluconate, caprate, malate, malonate, citrate, d-fructose, α-d-glucose, d-trehalose, methylpyruvate, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-galacturonic acid, d-gluconic acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, dl-lactic acid, propionic acid, d-saccharic acid, succinic acid, l-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-ornithine, l-proline, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-serine, dl-carnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid, urocanic acid, inosine, uridine and glycerol. Does not utilize the following substrates: maltose, phenylacetate, α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, glycogen, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, cellobiose, l-fucose, gentiobiose, α-d-lactose, lactulose, maltose, d-melibiose, methyl β-d-glucoside, d-raffinose, l-rhamnose, turanose, formic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, sebacic acid, glucuronamide, glycyl-l-aspartic acid, hydroxy l-proline, l-phenylalanine, d-serine, thymidine, phenylethylamine, putrescine, 2,3-butanediol, glucose 1-phosphate and glucose 6-phosphate. d-Psicose, d-alanine, d-glucosaminic acid, monomethyl succinate, acetic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, bromosuccinic acid, succinamic acid, alaninamide, glycyl-l-glutamic acid, l-leucine, l-threonine and 2-aminoethanol are weakly utilized. Other phenotypic characteristics are given in Table 1T1. The major fatty acids are C16 : 0 (27·5±0·7 %), C16 : 1 ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH (36·4±0·4 %) (summed feature 3) and C18 : 1 ω7c (19·4±0·2 %). The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 61·4 mol%.The type strain, CG20106T (=IMSNU 14100T=CIP 108524T=KCTC 12330T), was isolated from the surface tissue of a rusty root lesion of Korean ginseng.
DMBP00001740	Pseudomonas panipatensis (pa.ni.pa.ten′sis. N.L. fem adj. panipatensis pertaining to Panipat, the place of isolation of the bacterium).Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, non-sporulating, motile rods (1.0–1.2×2.8–3.5 μm). Possesses a single polar flagellum. Colonies are smooth, circular and muddy-white, growing up to 1.5 mm diameter on LB agar after 72 h incubation at 30 °C. Grows well at 28–37 °C and pH 5–9, but growth does not occur in the presence of 3 % NaCl. Positive for oxidase, catalase, DNase, nitrate reductase and urease, but negative for indole, methyl red/Voges–Proskauer, gelatinase and amylase. d-Glucose, d-fructose, d-galactose and d-arabinose are utilized as carbon sources, but not egg yolk, d-xylose, lactose or raffinose. Growth is observed on MacConkey agar. Acid is produced from d-glucose and maltose, but not from adonitol, mannitol, ribose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-arabinose, sucrose, xylose, raffinose or lactose. The fatty acid profile contains C10 : 0 3-OH (0.99 %), C12 : 0 (2.13 %), C12 : 0 2-OH (5.30 %), C12 : 0 3-OH (4.49 %), C14 : 0 (2.62 %), C16 : 0 (32.27 %), C17 : 0 cyclo (12.41 %), C18 : 1 ω7c (15.29 %), C18 : 0 (3.37 %), C19 : 0 cyclo ω8c (8.04 %) and summed feature 3 (C16 : 1 ω7c and/or C15 : 0 2-OH iso; 11.12 %). Table 1T1 summarizes other phenotypic properties.The type strain is Esp-1T (=MTCC 8990T=CCM 7469T), isolated from oil-contaminated soil of Panipat Oil Refinery, India.  The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of Pseudomonas panipatensis Esp-1T (=MTCC 8990T=CCM 7469T) is EF424401.DNA–DNA hybridization data for strain Esp-1T and related species are available with the online version of this paper.doi:
DMBP00001741	Pseudomonas paracarnis (pa.ra.car'nis. Gr. prep. para beside; L. gen. n. carnis of meat, and the specific epithet of a Pseudomonas species; N.L. gen. n. paracarnis close to Pseudomonas carnis). Cells are Gram-negative, motile, strictly aerobic, non-spore forming, short straight rods occurring mostly in pairs (~0.8–2.0µm in length, ~0.6µm wide), fluorescent on King B agar and typically positive for catalase and oxidase. Colonies are beige, circular convex, smooth and 0.5–1.0mm in diameter after incubation at 25 °C for 24h on Standard-I agar or Caso agar plus glucose. Growth occurs from 2 to 33 °C with an optimum around 25–30 °C, at NaCl concentrations up to at least 6% (w/v) and at pH ranging from 5.0 to 9.0. Grows on R2A and cetrimide agar, produces levan on Czapek Yeast Extract agar and is non-Haemolytic on Columbia blood agar. API 20NE tests show positive reactions with l-arginine, d-glucose (aerobic), l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, potassium gluconate, capric acid, malic acid and trisodium citrate but negative reactions with potassium nitrate, l-tryptophan, d-glucose, urea, 4-nitrophenyl-β-d-galactopyranoside, maltose, adipic acid and phenylacetic acid. V5/DAB/2/5T is able to lyse gelatin, but cannot use aesculin ferric citrate, while the reactions of the sister strain are variable in both cases. The API 50CHB/E substrates erythritol, l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, d-adonitol, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, d-fucose, d-arabitol and l-arabitol could be metabolized into acids, while d-arabinose, l-xylose, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin ferric citrate, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose (bovine), inulin, melezitose, maltitol, raffinose, starch, glycogen, gentiobiose, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, l-fucose, potassium gluconate, potassium 2-ketogluconate and potassium 5-ketogluconate were not metabolized. The two isolates differed only regarding the use of xylitol (V5/DAB/2/5T negative, UBT 403 positive). Biolog PM1 and PM2 tests were positive for l-arabinose, d-galactose, d-mannose, d-xylose, d-ribose, α-d-glucose, l-asparagine, l-glutamine, mucic acid, l-malic acid, l-lyxose, d-galacturonic acid, 2-aminoethanol, d-arabinose, 2-deoxy-d-ribose, d-fucose, d-glucosamine, 5-keto-d-gluconic acid, quinic acid and dihydroxyacetone but negative for the majority of substrates such as dulcitol, l-fucose, dl-α-glycerol-phosphate, formic acid, glucose 6-phosphate, l-rhamnose, maltose, melibiose, thymidine, d-aspartic acid, d-glucosaminic acid, 1,2-propanediol, α-ketobutyric acid, methyl α-d-galactoside, lactose, lactulose, uridine, m-tartaric acid, glucose 1-phosphate, fructose 6-phosphate, α-hydroxybutyric acid, methyl β-d-glucoside, maltotriose, 2-deoxy adenosine, glycyl-l-aspartic acid, d-threonine, glycolic acid, glyoxylic acid, cellobiose, tricarballylic acid, l-threonine, N-acetyl-β-d-mannosamine, monomethyl succinate, methyl pyruvate, d-malic acid, glycyl-l-proline, m-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, d-psicose, glucuronamide, pyruvic acid, l-galactonic acid-γ-lactone, phenylethylamine, chondroitin sulphate c, α-cyclodextrin, β-cyclodextrin, γ-cyclodextrin, dextrin, gelatin, glycogen, inulin, laminarin, mannan, pectin, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-neuraminic acid, amygdalin, arbutin, 3-o-β-d-gala cto-pyranosyl-d-arabinose, gentiobiose, l-glucose, lactitol, melezitose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl β-d-galactoside, 3-methyl glucose, methyl β-d-glucuronic acid, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl β-d-xyloside, palatinose, raffinose, salicin, sedoheptulosan, l-sorbose, stachyose, turanose, xylitol, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, δ-aminovaleric acid, butyric acid, capric acid, caproic acid, citraconic acid, citramalic acid, 2-hydroxybenzoic acid, 4-hydroxybenzoic acid, itaconic acid, d-lactic acid methyl ester, melibionic acid, oxalic acid, oxalomalic acid, d-ribono-1,4-lactone, sebacic acid, sorbic acid, succinamic acid, d-tartaric acid, l-tartaric acid, acetamide, l-alaninamide, glycine, l-homoserine, l-isoleucine, l-leucine, l-lysine, l-methionine, l-phenylalanine, l-valine, dl-carnitine, sec-butylamine, putrescine, 2,3-butanediol, 2,3-butanone and 3-hydroxy-2-butanone. For the remaining substrates the two isolates reacted differently. API ZYM results were positive for the activity of esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase and acid phosphatase, but negative for alkaline phosphatase, lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase. The predominant fatty acids of isolate V5/DAB/2/5T were C16:0 , summed feature C 16:1 ω7c/iso-C15:0 2-OH, C18:1 ω7c, C17:0 cyclo, C12:0 , C12:0 3-OH, C10:0 3-OH and C12:0 2-OH. The major polar lipids were hosphatidylethanolamine, amino lipid, phospholipid and phosphatidylglycerol; the major respiratory quinone was Q9 (95%), with a minor component of Q8 (5%). The type strain is V5/DAB/2/5T (=DSM 111363T=LMG 31846T), isolated from refrigerated dry aged beef. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 60.1mol% and the genome size is 6.13Mb. The ENA/GenBank/DDBJ accession number for the genome sequence is CAJFCN000000000. An additional strain of the species, UBT403 (=DSM 111362=LMG 31847), was isolated from a different sample of refrigerated minced beef differing in genome size (5.88Mb) and several metabolic features.
DMBP00001742	seudomonas parafulva. sp. nov. (parafulva pa. ra. ful’va; Gr. prefix para like; L. fem. adj. fulvus, yellow; N. L. fem. adj. parafulva fulva-like) Cells are rods, measuring 0.6 to 0.8 by 1.4 to 1.6 μm, with rounded ends. Gram negative. The cells occur singly, rarely in pairs, and are motile with polar flagella. Endospores are not formed. Granules of poly-β-hydroxybutyrate do not accumulate in the cells. Colonies on nutrient agar are smooth, entire, flat to convex, and pale yellow. A water-insoluble yellow pigment is produced on nutrient agar and Tryptic Soy Agar (Difco). A water-soluble fluorescent pigment is not produced on Pseudomonas agar F, King B medium, or Kato and Ito’s P-1 medium. No pyocyanin is produced on Pseudomonas agar P. Growth occurs on glutamate agar. Metabolism is strictly respiratory. Oxidative but not fermentative. Catalase and oxidase are produced. Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite in nitrate broth. Nitrate respiration is negative. Arginine dihydrolase is produced. Levan is not produced from sucrose. Starch and casein are not hydrolyzed. Growth occurs at 37°C but not at 41°C. Growth does not occur at pH 3.6. Cleavage of protocatechuate is of the ortho type. The assimilation pattern is shown in Table 5. DNA base composition is 60 mol%. The major fatty acids are C16 : 0, C16 : 1, and C18 : 1, and major 3-hydroxy fatty acids are C10 : 0 and C12 : 0. The major quinone is ubiquinone 9. Distributed to rice paddy. The type strain is AJ 2129T (_x0001_IFO 16636_x0001_JCM 11244_x0001_NRIC 0501), of which DNA base composition is 60.0 mol%. This strain was isolated from Japanese rice paddy by Iizuka and Komagata in 1963 (Iizuka and Komagata, 1963c).
DMBP00001743	 Pseudomonas paralactis (pa.ra.lac′tis. Gr. prep. para beside; L. gen. n. lactis from milk, referring to bovine raw milk, from which both original strains of the species were isolated; N.L. gen. n. paralactis beside lactis, referring to the close relationship to Pseudomonas lactis).Beige, smooth and round colonies of 0.5–1.0 mm diameter emerge after incubation at 25 °C for 24 h on TSG. Cells are rod-shaped with a size of 1.5–5.5 µm (average 2.4 µm) ×~0.75 µm, non-endospore-forming, fluorescent on King B agar, motile, catalase- and oxidase-positive and Gram-stain-negative. Grows from 4–35 °C (growth at temperatures lower than 4 °C has not been tested), with an optimal growth temperature between 27 and 31 °C. Grows at pH 5–8 (optimum pH 6.0–7.5) and in the presence of up to 6 % NaCl (w/v) (optimum 0–1 %). Positive for the utilization of d-adonitol, d-arabitol, d-fructose, d-glucose, d-galactose, d-lyxose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, d-ribose, trehalose, d-xylose, erythritol, glycerol, inositol, l-arabinose, l-arabitol, N-acetylglucosamine, potassium gluconate and xylitol as sole carbon source, and negative for the utilization of amygdalin, arbutin, d-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fucose, lactose, maltose, melezitose, d-melibiose, raffinose, d-sorbitol, sucrose, d-tagatose, turanose, dulcitol, gentiobiose, glycogen, l-fucose, l-rhamnose, l-sorbose, l-xylose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl β-d-xylopyranose and salicin as sole carbon source. Produces acid from glycerol, erythritol, l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, d-adonitol, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-rhamnose, inositol, d-mannitol, cellobiose, melibiose, trehalose, xylitol, gentiobiose, d-fucose, d-arabitol and l-arabitol. Grows on R2A agar and cetrimide agar and no blue pigment is formed on King A agar. No β-galactosidase activity is detected. Shows lipolysis on tributyrin-agar and proteolysis on skimmed milk agar at 4 and 25 °C. Haemolysis can be detected. Negative for hydrolysis of starch but positive for hydrolysis of gelatine. H2S is not produced. Negative for indole formation, Voges–Proskauer reaction and for the reduction of nitrate and nitrite. Does not produce lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, urease and tryptophan deaminase, but is positive for arginine dihydrolase. No growth is observed under anaerobic conditions. The predominant fatty acids of the type strain are C16 : 1ω7c/C15 : 0 iso 2-OH, C16 : 0, C18 : 1ω7c, C12 : 0, C12 : 0 3-OH, C12 : 0 2-OH and C10 : 0 3-OH, the major polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol and phospholipid, and the major respiratory quinone is Q-9.The type strain is WS 4672T (=DSM 29164T=LMG 28439T) and was isolated from raw bovine milk. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 59.7 mol% and the genome size is 6.02 Mb. WS 4998, an additional strain of the species, was isolated from the same raw milk sample.
DMBP00001744	DESCRIPTION OF PSEUDOMONAS PARAVERSUTA SP. NOV. P. paraversuta sp. nov. (pa.ra.ver.su'ta. Gr. prep. para beside; L. fem. adj. versuta versatile, shrewd, ingenious), and specific epithet of a Pseudomonas species; N.L. fem. adj. paraversuta beside [Pseudomonas] versuta), referring to the close relationship to the recently described species P. versuta [20, 46]. Cells are Gram-reaction-negative, do not grow under anaerobic conditions, are motile, non-spore forming, short straight rods, occurring singly, mostly in pairs, or in chains of three or four cells (length about 2.0µm, approximately 1.5µm wide), non-fluorescent on King B medium, and catalase- and oxidase-positive. Colonies are creamy, off-white, circular convex, smooth, around 0.5–1.0mm in diameter after incubation at 25 °C for 24h on Standard-I agar or Caso agar plus glucose. Grows on R2a and cetrimide agar, does not produce levan on Czapek yeast extract agar, shows no beta hemolysis of blood, does not reduce nitrate or liquefy gelatin. The growth temperature range is between 2 and 33°C and the optimum is between 15 and 27 °C, sodium chloride salt tolerance in Caso bouillon is up to 5% (w/v), optimal between 0.5 % and 3 %), and the isolates tolerate pH values from 6.0 up to 8.0. The major respiratory quinone is Q9 with a smaller proportion of Q8. The predominant fatty acids are C16:0 , C18:1 7c, C17:0 cyclo and a summed feature representing C16:1 7c and/or C15:0 iso 2-OH. API 50CH substrates (formation of acid) testing is negative for erythritol, l-xylose, d-adonitol, methyl-β-d-xylopyranoside, d-fructose, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d glucopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin ferric citrate, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose (bovine), melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, amylum, glycogen, xylitol, gentiobiose, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, potassium gluconate, potassium-2-ketogluconate and potassium-5-ketogluconate and positive for l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-mannose and d-fucose. API 20 NE substrate tests are negative for potassium nitrate, l-tryptophan, d-glucose (anaerobic), l-arginine, urea, gelatin (bovine), 4-nitrophenyl β-d-galactopyranoside, maltose, adipic acid and phenylacetatic acid and positive for d-glucose (aerobic), l-arabinose, d-mannose, N-acetyl-glucosamine, potassium gluconate, malic acid and trisodium citrate. API ZYM enzymatic reactions are negative for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl- β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase and positive for leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, acid phosphatase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase. The results of the Phenotype MicroArray PM1 (from Biolog) tests are negative for Tween 40, Tween 80, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, adonitol, cellobiose, lactose, lactulose, maltose, melibiose, methyl β-d-glucoside, d-psicose, l-rhamnose, formic acid, d-galacturonic acid, d-glucosaminic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketobutyric acid, glucuronamide, thymidine, phenylethylamine, 2-aminoethanol, α-d-glucose 1-phosphate, d-glucose 6-phosphate, succinic acid, trehalose, dulcitol, d-sorbitol, glycerol, l-fucose, l-lactic acid, d-mannitol, Tween 20, d-fructose, acetic acid, 1,2-propanediol, methyl α-d-galactoside, sucrose, uridine, meso-tartaric acid, fructose 6-phosphate, α-hydroxyglutaric acid γ-lactone, maltotriose, 2′-deoxyadenosine, adenosine, glycyl l-aspartic acid, d-threonine, bromosuccinic acid, glycolic acid, glyoxylic acid, inosine, glycyl glutamic-acid, tricarballylic acid, l-serine, l-threonine, l-alanyl glycine, acetoacetic acid, N-acetyl-β- d-mannosamine, monomethyl succinate, methyl pyruvate, d-malic acid, glycyl-l-proline, m-hydroxyphenyl acetic acid, tyramine, l-lyxose and l-galactonic acid γ-lactone and positive for d-aspartic acid, d-ribose, d-xylose, l-fucose, d-galactose and l-arabinose. The Phenotype MicroArray PM2A (Biolog) test results are negative for chondroitin sulphate c, α-cyclodextrin, β-cyclodextrin, γ-cyclodextrin, dextrin, gelatin, glycogen, inulin, laminarin, mannan, pectin, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-neuraminic acid, β-d-allose, amygdalin, d-arabinose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, arbutin, 2-deoxy-d-ribose, i-erythritol, d-fucose, 3–0-β-d-galactopyranosyl-d-arabinose, gentiobiose, l-glucose, lactitol, melezitose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl β-d-galactoside, 3-methyl glucose, methyl β-d-glucuronic acid, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl β-d-xyloside, palatinose, raffinose, salicin, sedoheptulosan, l-sorbose, stachyose, d-tagatose, turanose, xylitol, N-acetyl-d-glucosaminitol, δ-aminovaleric acid, butyric acid, caproic acid, citraconic acid, citramalic acid, 2-hydroxybenzoic acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, itaconic acid, d-lactic acid methyl ester, malonic acid, melibionic acid, oxylic acid, oxalomalic acid, d-ribono-1,4-lactone, sebacic acid, sorbic acid, succinamic acid, d-tartaric acid, l-tartaric acid, acetamide, l-alaninamide, l-arginine, glycine, l-homoserine, l-isoleucine, l-leucine, l-lysine, l-methionine, l-phenylalanine, l-valine, dl-carnitine, secbutylamine, dl-octopamine, 2,3-butanediol, 2,3-butanone and 3-hydroxy-2-butanone and positive for d-arabinose, d-glucosamine, quinic acid and l-pyroglutamic acid. Substrates or reactions included in the kits but not mentioned differ between the isolates. The type strain is V4/DAB/S4/2aT (=DSM 111361T=LMG 31844T) and originated from refrigerated raw beef isolated after several weeks of ripening. DNA G+C content is 58.6 (mol%) and the genome size is 5.0Mb. The GenBank/ EMBL/DDBJ accession number for the nearly complete 16S rRNA gene sequence is KX186982, the ENA/GenBank/ DDBJ accession number for the draft genome sequence is CAJFCL000000000. A sister strain of this novel species, UBT376 (=DSM 111360=LMG 31845; accession number CAJFDA000000000), of similar genome size and DNA G+C content, was isolated some years later from refrigerated ground beef.
DMBP00001745	Pseudomonas peli (pe′li. Gr. n. pelos sludge; N.L. gen. n. peli of sludge).After 24 h incubation at 28 °C on TSA, colonies are 1–2 mm, smooth, round with irregular edges and beige to yellow. Cells are rod-shaped (1 μm wide and 2–3 μm long) with rounded ends, Gram-negative, non-spore-forming and non-fluorescent. Cells are motile and oxidase- and catalase-positive. After 24 h, good growth is observed at 28–37 °C, but not below 20 °C or above 45 °C. No anaerobic growth is observed. Enzyme activities and carbon source utilization are given in Table 3T3. Can be differentiated from the type strain of its closest phylogenetic neighbour, P. anguilliseptica LMG 21629T, by the presence of esterase lipase, the absence of acid phosphatase and the inability to reduce nitrate and to assimilate d-galactose, caprate and citrate.The type strain is LMG 23201T (=DSM 17833T=R-20805T), which has a DNA G+C content of 60.7 mol%. The type strain and strain R-20815 were isolated from a nitrifying inoculum in Gent, Belgium.

DMBP00001747	Pseudomonas pharmafabricae (phar.ma.fab’ri.cae. L. masc. gen. n. pharmafabricae from a pharmaceutical factory).Cells are Gram-stain-negative, aerobic, rod-shaped (0.3–0.5?×?1.0–1.2 ?m) and motile with single polar flagellum (Supplementary Fig. S1). Colonies are 2–3 mm in diameter, circular, canary yellow, semi-transparent with entire margins after incubation on LB agar at 35 °C for 2 days. Growth occurs at 4–42 °C (optimum, 35 °C), pH 5.0–9.0 (optimum, pH 6.0) and with 0–5% (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 2%). Catalase- and oxidase-positive. Positive results in tests for aerobic reduction of nitrate and nitrite, hydrolysis of Tween 20, Tween 40 and Tween 60. Sensitive to tobramycin, rifamycin, erythromycin, ofloxacin, kanamycin, doxycycline and ciprofloxacin. Negative results in tests for Voges–Proskauer, methyl red, hydrolysis of starch, gelatin, casein, tyrosine, Tween 80 and urea. Indole and H2S are not produced. Resistant to ampicillin, nystatin, bacitracin, vancomycin and clindamycin. In API ZYM tests, production of alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase and leucine arylamidase are positive reactions. In API 20NE tests, positive results are obtained for activity of arginine dihydrolase and assimilation of malic acid. In API 50CH tests, acid is produced from glycerol, d-ribose, d-xylose, d-galactose, d-fructose, d-mannose, esculin ferric citrate, d-maltose, d-melibiose, d-fucose, potassium gluconate and potassium 5-ketogluconate. In GN2 MicroPlates analysis, positive results were observed for utilization of pyruvic acid methyl ester, acetic acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, d,l-lactic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, succinamic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-alaninamide, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-asparagine, l-histidine, hydroxy-l-proline, l-proline, inosine and putrescine. The predominant isoprenoid quinone is Q-9, and presence of trace amounts of Q-8. The major fatty acids (>?10%) are C12:0, C16:0, C18:1 ω7c and summed features 3 (C16:1 ω7c and/or iso-C15:0 2OH). The polar lipids are PE, PG, DPG, one unidentified aminophospholipid (APL), one unidentified aminolipid (AL), two unidentified phospholipids (PL1, PL2) and two unknown glycolipids (GL1, GL2). The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 62.6 mol%.The type strain, ZYSR67-ZT (=?CGMCC 1.15498T?=?JCM 31306T) was isolated from pharmaceutical wastewater sample collected in Jinhua, Zhejiang province, China.DOI： 10.1007/s00284-018-1495-z
DMBP00001748	Pseudomonas phragmitis (phrag.mi'tis. L. gen. n. phragmitis of reed, of the plant genus Phragmites). Cells form rods, 1.0–2.5µm long and 0.3–0.5µm wide. They are Gram-stain-negative, non-spore-forming, and motile by means of a single polar flagellum. They grow aerobically and chemorganotrophically. Colonies on LB are smooth, circular and creamy yellow. Growth occurs at 10–41 °C, pH 6–10 and in 0–10% (w/v) NaCl. Neither pyocyanin nor fluorescent pigment is produced on King A or King B agar. Catalase and oxidase are positive. Nitrate is reduced. In API 20NE tests, cells react positively for capric acid, malic acid and trisodium citrate, but negatively for denitrification to N2 , indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihy drolase, urease, aesculin hydrolysis, gelatin hydrolysis, and utilization of d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, potassium gluconate and phenylacetic acid. Positive for esterase lipase, lipase, leucine arylamidase, and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, but negative for the other API ZYM tests. In Biolog GN2 tests, cells can grow on glycogen, tween 40, tween 80, pyruvic acid methyl ester, succinic acid monomethyl ester, acetic acid, cis aconitic acid, citric acid, formic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, α-Ketobutyric acid, dl-lactic acid, propionic acid, sebacic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, l-alaninamide, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-proline, γ-aminobutyric acid, urocanic acid and putrescine, but cannot grow on the other substances included in the tests. The predominant fatty acids (>10 %) include summed feature 8 (C18:1 ω6c and/or C18:1 ω7c), C16:0 , C17:0 cyclo and C12:0 . The type strain is S-6-2T (=CGMCC 1.15798T=KCTC 52539T), which was isolated from petroleum-polluted river sediment, Huangdao, Shandong Province, China. The genome of the type strain is characterized by a size of 4.04 Mbp and a DNA G+C content of 60.1mol%. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession number for the 16S rRNA gene and the complete genome sequences of S-6-2T are MF372122 and CP020100, respectively
DMBP00001749	 Pseudomonas piscicola (pis.ci’co.la. L. masc. n. piscis, fish; L. masc./fem. suff. -cola, inhabitant dweller; from L. masc./fem. n. incola, dweller; N.L. fem. n. piscicola, fish-dweller)Cells are aerobic, Gram- negative, rod- shaped (2.6–0.7 µm long, 0.7–0.3 µm wide), with monopolar flagellation, oxidase- and catalase- positive. Colonies on King B agar are round, flat, opaque and beige-coloured, with regular margins and approximately 1–2 mm in diameter after growth for 2 days at 30 °C. Fluorescein pigment is produced, but pyocyanin is not. Bacterial growth occurs at 4–37 °C and pH 7–9. Cells tolerate 0–4.5 % NaCl. All strains are α-Haemolytic. In the API 20NE test, strains are positive for indole production and the assimilation of glucose, arabinose, mannose, mannitol, gluconate, caprate, malate, citrate and phenylacetate. Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite. Plate test analysis performed using the Biolog GENIII system indicate that these strains have the ability to oxidize a variety of carbon sources including α-d-glucose, Tween 40, d-mannose, d-mannitol, methyl pyruvate, γ-amino-butyric acid, d-fructose, d-arabitol, l-alanine, d-galactose, l-arginine, d-gluconic acid, l-lactic acid, β-hydroxy-d,l-butyric acid, glycogen, l-aspartic acid, citric acid, l-glutamic acid, α-keto glutaric acid, mucic acid, propionic acid, l-pyroglutamic acid, quinic acid, l-malic acid, acetic acid, inosine, l-serine, bromo-succinic acid and formic acid. Strains are able to grow in the presence of troleandomycin, lincomycin, vancomycin, nalidixic acid, aztreonam, fusidic acid, rifamycin SV, guanidine HCl, tetrazolium violet, d-serine, niaproof 4, tetrazolium blue and potassium tellurite. Other tests produce negative or weak results. Predominant cellular fatty acids include summed feature 3 (C16 : 1 ω7c and/or C16 : 1 ω6c), C16 : 0, summed feature 8 (C18 : 1 ω6c and/or C18 : 1 ω7c) with minor amounts of C12 : 0- 3OH, C12 : 0, C10 : 0- 3OH and C12 : 0- 2OH (Table 5 in Int J Syst Evol Microbiol 2019; 71 : 004714. DOI 10.1099/ijsem.0.004714).The type strain is P50T (=CCUG 74871T=CECT 30175T) isolated from Oncorhynchus mykiss. The DNA G+C base content is 58.49 mol%. The whole- genome shotgun project for strain P50T has been deposited in the DDBJ/ENA/GenBank databases under the accession number JACMYF000000000. The version described in this paper is the first version. The 16S rRNA gene sequence, characterizing the type strain is available under the accession number LR797557.1The authors apologize for any inconvenience caused.
DMBP00001750	DESCRIPTION OF PSEUDOMONAS PISCICULTURAE SP. NOV.Pseudomonas pisciculturae (pis.ci.cul.tu'rae. L. masc. n. piscis fish, L.gen. n. culturae of culture, N.L. gen. n. pisciculturae, of fish cultivation).Cells are aerobic, Gram-negative, aerobic, rod-­­shaped (2.1–1.7 µm long, 0.5–0.3 µm wide), with lophotrichous flagellation, oxidase- and catalase-positive. Colonies on King B agar are round, flat, translucent and beige-coloured, with regular margins (2 mm in diameter) and the colour of the medium turns yellow after growth for 2 days at 30 °C. Fluorescein pigment is produced, but pyocyanin is not. The strain is γ-Haemolytic. Bacterial growth occurs at 4–37 °C and pH 7–10. Cells tolerate 0–6 % NaCl. In the API 20NE test, strains are positive for indole production, presence of arginine dihydrolase, hydrolysis of aesculin and the assimilation of glucose, arabinose, mannose, mannitol, N-­acetyl-­d-­glucosamine, gluconate, caprate, malate, citrate and phenylacetate. Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite. Plate test analysis performed using the Biolog GENIII system indicate that these strains have the ability to oxidize a variety of carbon sources including α-­d-­glucose, d-­sorbitol, p-­hydroxy-­phenylacetic acid, d-­mannose, d-­mannitol, d-­galacturonic acid, γ-amino-butyric acid, d-­fructose, d-­arabitol, l-­alanine, d-­galactonic acid lactone, trehalose, d-­galactose, myo-­inositol, l-­arginine, d-­gluconic acid, l-­lactic acid, β-hydroxy-d,l-­butyric acid, glycogen, l-­aspartic acid, d-­glucuronic acid, citric acid, N-­acetyl-­d-­glucosamine, l-­glutamic acid, α-keto glutaric acid, l-­histidine, mucic acid, d-­malic acid, propionic acid, l-­rhamnose, l-­pyroglutamic acid, quinic acid, l-­malic acid, acetic acid, inosine, l-­serine and d-­saccharic acid. Strains are able to grow in the presence of 1 % sodium lactate, troleandomycin, lincomycin, vancomycin, nalidixic acid, aztreonam, fusidic acid, rifamycin SV, guanidine HCL, tetrazolium violet, d-­serine, minocycline, niaproof 4, tetrazolium blue and potassium tellurite. Other tests produce negative or weak results. The predominant cellular fatty acids include C16 : 0 (37.7 %), summed feature 3 (C16 : 1 ω7c and/or C16 : 1 ω6c, 35.2 %), summed feature 8 (C18 : 1ω6c and/or C18 : 1 ω7c, 9.7 %), C12 : 0-­3OH (3.9 %), C12 : 0-­2OH (3.8 %), C10 : 0-­3OH (3.7 %), C12 : 0 (3.3 %) and C17 : 0cyclo (1.5 %) (Table 5).The type strain is P115T (=CCUG74873T=CECT 30173T), isolated from Oncorhynchus mykiss. The DNA G+C base content is 60.02 mol%. The whole-­genome shotgun project for strain P115T has been deposited in the DDBJ/ENA/GenBank databases under the accession number JACVZE000000000. The version described in this paper is the first version. The 16S rRNA gene sequence, characterizing the type strain is available under the accession number LR797573.1 
DMBP00001751	DESCRIPTION OF PSEUDOMONAS PISCIS SP. NOV. Pseudomonas piscis (pis'cis. L. gen. n. piscis of a fish)Cells are Gram-stain-negative, strictly aerobic, motile by polar multitrichous ﬂagella, non-spore-forming, short rod-shaped, 0.4–0.6 µm in width and 0.9–1.8 µm in length. Growth occurs at 15–37 °C (optimal temperature, 28 °C), at pH 5.5–8.5 (optimal pH, 7.5) and with 0–5.0 % (w/v) NaCl (optimal concentration, 2.0 %). Positive for catalase, oxidase, d-glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase and citrate utilization; weakly positive for urease; but negative for nitrate reduction, denitrification, indole production, d-glucose fermentation, β-glucosidase (aesculin hydrolysis), gelatin hydrolysis, beta-galactosidase, H2S production, tryptophane deaminase, indole production, acetoin production (Voges–Proskauer) and gelatinase. In API ZYM tests, shows positive results for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase; weakly positive results for lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase and α-chymotrypsin; negative results for α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase. Utilizes trehalose, d-mannose, glycerol, glycyl-l-proline, l-alanine, l-arginine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-serine, d-gluconic acid, glucuronamide, l-lactic acid, citric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, propionic acid, acetic acid, γ-aminobutryric acid and β-hydroxy-d,l butyric acid. Acid is produced from d-glucose, l-arabinose (weak), d-mannose, d-mannitol (weak), N-acetyl-glucosamine, maltose (weak), potassium gluconate, capric acid, adipic acid (weak), malic acid, trisodium citrate and phenylacetic acid (weak). The principal fatty acids are C16 : 0, summed feature 3 (iso-C15 : 0 2-OH and/or C16 : 1ω7c) and summed feature 8 (C18 : 1ω7c and/or C18 : 1ω6c). The respiratory quinone is Q-9. The polar lipid profile consists of diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, unidentified glycolipids, an unidentified lipid, an unknown glycolipid and aminolipid.The type strain, MC042T (=KCTC 72033T=MCCC 1K03575T), was isolated from the profound head ulcers of farmed Murray cod (Maccullochella peelii peelii) from the town of Dajing (28° 41′ N, 121° 14′ E), Yueqing City, Zhejiang Province, China. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 63.6 mol%. The draft genome of strain MC042T has been deposited at DDBJ/ENA/GenBank under accession WHUV00000000.
DMBP00001752	Pseudomonas plecoglossicida (ple.co.glos.si.ci«da. M.L. masc. n. Plecoglossus systematic name of a fish genus; L. suffix masc. n. -cida killer; M.L. masc. n. plecoglossicida the killer of Plecoglossus, the genus to which ayu belongs). Cells are Gram-negative rods (0.5–1*2.5–4.5 µm), and are motile by means of polar multitrichous flagella, and in some cases exhibit single or no flagellum. Intracellular granules of poly-β-hydroxybutyrate are not accumulated. Metabolism is oxidative. Growth occurs at temperatures between 10 and 30 °C in the presence of 0–5% (w}v) NaCl. Catalase and cytochrome oxidase are produced. Fluorescent pigment is produced weakly on King medium B. Hydrolysis of gelatin, starch and Tween 80 is negative. Lecithinase is not produced. Arginine dihydrolase is produced. Lysine and ornithine are not decarboxylated. These organisms are not able to form levan from sucrose. They reduce nitrate to nitrite but do not denitrificate it to N2 gas. They are Haemolytic on blood agar. They utilize the following substrates as sole carbon sources for growth: caprate, succinate, citrate, L-alanine, β-alanine, L-aspartate, L-glutamate, L-arginine, L-tyrosine, glucose, D-fructose, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate, D-malate, propylene glycol, ethanol, n-butanol, phenyl acetate, glycine, L-leucine, L-valine, L-lysine, L-ornithine, L-citrulline, L-histidine and L-phenylalanine. They do not use the following compounds as sole carbon sources: maltose, cellobiose, lactose, starch, inulin, L-threonine, mannitol, D-xylose, L-arabinose, L-rhamnose, D-mannose, D-galactose, sucrose, trehalose, adipate, D-(-)-tartrate, L-(+_x001f_)-tartrate, m-tartrate, erythritol, sorbitol, m-inositol, adonitol, geraniol, phenol, testosterone, L-tryptophan, L-kynurenine, anthranilate or nicotinate. The following enzymes are produced (determined by using API ZYM): alkaline phosphatase, caprylate esterase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase and phosphoamidase. The following enzymes are not produced (determined by using API ZYM): butyrate esterase (C4), myristate lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β- galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase or α-fucosidase. The G_x001f_C content of the DNA is 62.8 mol%. The type strain is FPC 951T; it has been deposited in the American Type Culture Collection, Manassas, VA, USA, as strain ATCC 700383T. This strain was isolated in 1994 from bacterial haemorrhagic ascites of ayu (Plecoglossus altivelis) in Tokushima Prefecture, Japan. One additional strain, FPC 941 (=ATCC 700384), which was isolated in 1994 from the diseased ayu in Shiga Prefecture in Japan, is a reference strain of this species.
DMBP00001753	Pseudomonas poae (po′ae. Gr. n. poa grass; N.L. gen. n. poae of/from grass).Cells are motile by one polar flagellum and are 2·5–3·3?μm long and about 0·8?μm wide. Strains show a weak oxidase reaction. Ice nucleation activity is negative. In addition to the general description, the following substances are assimilated: 2-aminoethanol, β-hydroxybutyric acid, l-proline, l-histidine, dl-lactic acid, putrescine, quinic acid, succinaminic acid, sucrose, d-trehalose and Tween 40. None of the strains assimilates γ-hydroxybutyric acid, d-cellobiose, i-erythritol, glucose 6-phosphate, dl-α-glycerol phosphate, glycyl l-aspartic acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, α-ketovaleric acid, d-sorbitol or l-rhamnose. Gelatinase, casein hydrolysis and utilization of glycogen, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, α-d-glucose, d-psicose, monomethyl succinate, formic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketobutyric acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, hydroxy-l-proline, l-ornithine, d-serine and dl-carnitine are strain-dependent.The type strain, P 527/13T (=DSM 14936T=LMG 21465T), was isolated from the phyllosphere of grasses in Paulinenaue (Germany).
DMBP00001754	Pseudomonas pohangensis (po.hang.en′sis. N.L. adj. pohangensis referring to Pohang city in Korea, where the type strain was found).Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile, non-spore-forming rods approximately 0.6–0.8×1.5–3.0 μm in size. Colonies are irregular and cream-coloured after 48 h on MA. Cells are non-fluorescent on King A and B media. Catalase- and oxidase-positive. Growth occurs at temperatures of 4–35 °C (optimum 25–30 °C), pH 5–9 (optimum pH 7–8) and at NaCl concentrations of up to 3.0 % (optimum 1.0 %). Does not hydrolyse alginic acid, casein, chitin, carboxymethylcellulose, DNA, gelatin, starch, tyrosine or urea. Major fatty acids are summed feature 3 and C16 : 0, with lesser amounts of C12 : 0, C12 : 0 3-OH, C 18 : 1ω7c and C14 : 0. The major isoprenoid quinone is Q-9. The DNA G+C content is 64.0 mol%.The type strain, H3-R18T (=KACC 11517T=DSM 17875T), was isolated from seashore sand collected from Homi cape, Pohang city, Korea. 
DMBP00001755	 Pseudomonas populi (po′pu.li. L. fem. gen. n. populi of a poplar tree, pertaining to Populus euphratica, the Latin name for the poplars that grow in the forest from which the type strain was isolated).Cells are Gram-stain negative, non-spore-forming, non-motile, aerobic and rod-shaped. Colonies on LB are creamy, circular, convex, smooth and measure 0.5–1.5 mm in diameter after incubation for 3 days at 37 °C. The temperature, pH and NaCl concentration ranges for growth are 4–45 °C (optimum 37 °C), 1–3 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum 1 %, w/v) and pH 5.5–9.5 (optimum pH 7.5), respectively. Optimum growth occurs at 37 °C, at pH 7.5 and in the presence of 1 % NaCl. Positive for catalase and oxidase activities. In API 20NE, positive for assimilation of caprate, potassium nitrate and adipate, and negative for indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease, hydrolysis of aesculin and gelatin, and assimilation of d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, potassium gluconate, malic acid, trisodium citrate and phenylacetic acid. Hydrolyses Tween 80 extracellularly but not alginate, starch, casein or DNA. In the API ZYM system, positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), acid phosphatase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase. Negative for lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase. In the Biolog GN3 system, positive for utilization of d-fucose, l-serine, d-fructose, l-alanine, l-arginine, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-pyroglutamic, l-lactic acid, citric acid, l-malic acid, propionic acid, γ-aminobutryric acid, acetic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, d-salicin, glycyl-l-proline, l-aspartic acid, pectin, d-galacturonic acid, l-galactonic acid lactone, d-gluconic acid, d-glucuronic acid, glucuronamide, mucic acid, d-saccharic acid, methyl pyruvate, bromosuccinic acid, acetoacetic acid and formic acid. Negative for utilization of the following carbon sources: dextrin, maltose, trehalose, cellobiose, gentiobiose, sucrose, turanose, stachyose, raffinose, melibiose, l-fucose, l-rhamnose, d-serine, d-sorbitol, d-arabitol, myo-inositol, d-aspartic acid, d-lactic acid methyl ester, d-mannose, d-galactose, fusidic acid, d-mannitol, glycerol and l-butyric acid. The major cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0, summed feature 8 (C18 : 1ω7c and/or C18 : 1ω6c) and C17 : 0 cyclo. The major isoprenoid quinone is Q-9. The major polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylcholine and diphosphatidylglycerol; minor amounts of several unidentified polar lipids are also present.The type strain, KBL-4-9T ( = JCM 19138T = CCTCC AB 2013069T = NRRL B-59988T), was isolated from Populus euphratica of ancient Khiyik river in Xinjiang, PR China. The DNA G+C content of strain KBL-4-9T is 61.6 mol%.
DMBP00001756	Pseudomonas prosekii: N.L. gen. masc. n. prosekii, of Pro?ek, in honour of the Czech geographer Pavel Pro?ek, for his influential participation in the establishment of the Czech polar station J.G. Mendel.Cells of P. prosekii are Gram-negative short rods and are motile. The culture is oxidase- and catalase-positive with oxidative metabolism, producing a fluorescent pigment on King B medium. Growth occurs between 5 and 30 °C. Growth on TSA supplemented with 6.5 % NaCl is not observed. Colonies are smooth with regular margins, non-pigmented and 2 mm in diameter. The strains are positive in utilisation of citrate and malonate, decarboxylation of arginine and acid formation from xylose. The strains did not reduce nitrate and nitrite. Negative for decarboxylations of ornithine and lysine, hydrolyses of esculin and starch, production of urease and DNase. The strains possess the following positive or borderline Biolog characteristics: dextrin; l-arabinose; d-galactose; α-d-glucose; acetic acid; d-gluconic acid; propionic acid; bromosuccinic acid; d-alanine; l-alanine; l-alanylglycine; l-proline; γ-amino butyric acid and formic acid. Negative Biolog utilisations for all strains were: α-cyclodextrin, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine; N-cetyl-d-glucosamine; adonitol; d-cellobiose; i-erythritol; l-fucose; gentiobiose; m-inositol; α-d-lactose; lactulose; maltose; d-melibiose; β-methyl-d-glucoside; d-psicose; d-raffinose; l-rhamnose; sucrose; cis-aconitic acid; d-galactonic acid lactone; d-galacturonic acid; d-glucosaminic acid; d-glucuronic acid; α-hydroxybutyric acid; γ-hydroxybutyric acid; p-hydroxy phenylacetic acid; itaconic acid; malonic acid; quinic acid; sebacic acid; succinamic acid; glycyl-l-aspartic acid; l-histidine; hydroxy-l-proline; l-leucine; l-ornithine; l-phenylalanine; l-pyroglutamic acid; d,l-carnitine; urocanic acid; uridine; thymidine; phenyethylamine; putrescine; 2-aminoethanol; 2,3-butanediol; glycerol; d,l-α-glycerol phosphate; α-d-glucose-1-phosphate and d-glucose-6-phosphate. More than half the strains are positive in oxidation of d,l-lactic acid; d-saccharic acid; l-alaninamide; l-asparagine; l-aspartic acid; l-glutamic acid; l-serine; l-threonine, and negative in oxidation of glycogen; Tween 80; d-arabitol; d-mannitol; d-sorbitol; d-trehalose; turanose; xylitol; pyruvic acid methyl ester; succinic acid mono-methyl-ester; citric acid; β-hydroxybutyric acid; α-keto butyric acid; α-keto glutaric acid; α-keto valeric acid; succinic acid; glucuronamide; glycyl-l-glutamic acid; d-serine and inosine. Utilisation of Tween 40, d-mannose, d-fructose are variable Biolog characteristics.The type strain is AN/28/1T, deposited as CCM 7990T and LMG 26867T.
DMBP00001757	Pseudomonas protegens (pro’te.gens. L. part. adj. protegens protecting, referring to the ability of the organism to protect plants from soil-borne phytopathogens). Cells of type strain CHA0 in culture are rods (0.3–0.5 × 1–4 μm) with one to three flagella [67]. Colonies on King’s B agar medium are white-yellowish and become fluorescent under UV light. The doubling time of strain CHA0 is 50 min at 30 ◦C in the rich medium nutrient-yeast extract [67]. Growth occurs between 4 ◦C and 36 ◦C [67]. All Phl+ Plt+ strains are strict aerobes, oxidase-positive, arginine dihydrolase positive, gelatinase-positive (with the exception of strain Pf-5), and hydrolyse Tween 80 (polyoxyethylene sorbitan monooleate). Nitrate is not reduced. Strains do not produce levan, are not pectinolytic and do not hydrolyse DNA and aesculin. A few strains can cause hypersensitivity on tobacco leaves. Acid is produced from mannitol but not from sorbitol and erythritol. Alcalinisation is produced from DL lactate but not from L(+) and D(−) tartrate. On biotype 100 strips, P. protegens strains assimilate the following 45 substrates: alpha-D(+) glucose, beta-D(+) fructose, D(+) trehalose, D(+) mannose, glycerol, myo-inositol, D-mannitol, L(−) malate, cis-aconitate, trans-aconitate, citrate, 2-keto-D-gluconate, N-acetyl-D-glucosamine, D-gluconate, phenylacetate, protocatechuate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, (−) quinate, benzoate, betain, putrescine, DL-alpha-amino-n-butyrate, histamine, DL-lactate, caprate, caprylate, succinate, fumarate, glutarate, DL-glycerate, DL-alpha-amino-n-valerate, ethanolamine, D-glucosamine, itaconate, DL-beta-hydroxybutyrate, L-aspartate, L-glutamate, L-proline, D-alanine, L-alanine, L-serine, malonate, propionate, L-tyrosine, 2-ketoglutarate, and 2-oxoglutarate. In contrast, the following 49 biotype-100 substrates are not assimilated: D(+) galactose, L(+) sorbose, alpha-D(+) melibiose, D(+) raffinose, maltotriose, maltose, alpha-lactose, lactulose, 1-0-methyl-betagalactopyranoside, 1-0-methyl-alpha-galactopyranoside, D(+) cellobiose, beta-gentiobiose, 1-0-methyl-beta-D-glucopyranoside, aesculin, L(+) arabinose, D(+) xylose, palatinose, alpha-L-rhamnose, alpha-L(-) fucose, D(+) melezitose, L(−) arabitol, xylitol, dulcitol, D-tagatose, maltitol, D(+) turanose, D-sorbitol, adonitol, hydroxyquinoline-beta-glucuronide, D-lyxose, i-erythritol, 1-0- methyl-alpha-D-glucopyranoside, 3-0-methyl-D-glucopyranose, D-saccharate, mucate, L(+) tartrate, D(−) tartrate, mesotartrate, tricarballylate, D-galacturonate, 5-keto-D-gluconate, L-tryptophan, gentisate, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 3-phenylpropionate, m-coumarate, trigonelline, L-histidine, tryptamine. All P. protegens strains are ACC deaminase-negative [69]. Reduction of manganese is variable [57]. In addition to Phl and Plt, P. protegens strains also produce the biocontrol metabolites HCN and pyrrolnitrin [56; our unpublished results]. Strains of P. protegens are typically soil inhabitants and are mostly isolated from plant roots. Strains of the species are characterized by their unique pyoverdine siderotype. The type strain CHA0 was isolated from tobacco roots in Switzerland. It has been deposited at the CFBP (as CFBP 6595) and at the DSM (as DSM 19095). No plasmid has been found in strain CHA0 [67]. The G + C content of strains CHA0 and Pf- 5 is 60.1 and 63.3 mol%, respectively (i.e. well within the range (58–69 mol%) of the genus Pseudomonas [42]). The type strain presents all the properties given above for the species description. In addition, it is lecithinase-positive, urease-positive, lysine decarboxylase-negative, ornithine decarboxylase-negative, tryptophan deaminase-negative [67].doi:10.1016/j.syapm.2010.10.005 
DMBP00001758	Pseudomonas proteolytica (pro.te.o.ly′ti.ca. N.L. fem. adj. proteolytica proteolytic).Forms circular, convex, smooth and translucent colonies with a diameter of 1–2 mm. Cells are Gram-negative, motile with a polar flagellum, rod-shaped and psychrophilic (grow at 4–30 °C), can tolerate 3 % NaCl (w/v) and grow at an optimum pH of 7. Positive for catalase, oxidase, lipase and gelatinase; reduces nitrate to nitrite; negative for phosphatase, urease, β-galactosidase, arginine dihydrolase, arginine decarboxylase, lysine decarboxylase, indole production, methyl red and Voges–Proskauer test. Does not hydrolyse aesculin, starch or cellulose. Acid is produced from d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-mannose and d-mannitol, but not from l-arabinose, lactose, l-rhamnose, sucrose or d-xylose. Utilizes acetate, adonitol, citrate, meso-erythritol, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, meso-inositol, lactic acid, d-mannose, d-mannitol, pyruvate, d-ribose, sorbitol, trehalose, l-alanine, l-arginine, l-glutamic acid, l-glutamine, l-lysine, l-serine, l-methionine, l-phenylalanine, l-tyrosine and l-tryptophan as sole carbon sources, but not d-cellobiose, cellulose, dextran, dulcitol, fumaric acid, inulin, lactose, d-maltose, d-melibiose, melezitose, d-raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbose, sucrose, succinic acid, thioglycollate, d-xylose, l-aspartic acid, l-aspargine, l-cysteine, l-glycine, l-histidine, l-leucine, l-isoleucine, l-proline, l-threonine or l-valine. Resistant to ampicillin, amoxycillin, bacitracin, carbenicillin, chloramphenicol, cotrimoxazole, erythromycin, furazolidone, furoxone, lincomycin, nitrofurazone, nitrofurantoin, nystatin, penicillin and trimethoprim, but sensitive to chlortetracycline, colistin, gentamicin, kanamycin, oxytetracycline, polymyxin B, rifampicin, tetracycline and tobramycin. DNA G+C content is 58·3 mol%.The type strain is CMS 64T (=MTCC 4994T=DSM 15321T).doi:10.1099/ijs.0.02827-0 
DMBP00001759	Pseudomonas psychrophila (sp. nov.) psy.chro'phi.la M. L.Adj. Psychrophila cold-loving (bacterium).The cells are gram negative (0.5-0.9 by 1.2-2.8 μm), motile by means of a single polar flagellum. Colonies are circular and colorless. Catalase and oxidase reactions are positive. Growth occurs in media supplemented with 0%4% NaCI but not in media with salinity higher than 8% NaCl. Growth occurs at -1° to 35°C, but no growth is observed at 40°C or higher. The optimum growth temperature of the strain was 25°C. Methyl red, urease, and arginine dihydrolase tests are positive but the Voges-Proskaur test and tests for indole, H,S production, lysine, and ornithine decarboxylase are negative. The nitrate reduction test was weakly positive. Acid is produced from D-glucose, L-arabinose, D-fructose, D-mannose, melibiose, sucrose, D-xylose, raffinose, mannitol, galactose, and trehalose.No acid is produced from maltose, inositol, sorbitol, or rhamnose.
